text: Over priced Steak Frites and Fries. The fries were bland and lacked the zing of the signature Wolf Gang brand. Good service kinda offset the mediocre food.

Appetizers are good, drinks are good - service is hit and miss - entrees just aren't cutting it. They cannot get them right. Out of 6 meals, 2 were ok not fantastic. The Linguine in Clam sauce was highly recommended by the waiter, when it arrived - only 8 over cooked clams on each plate. 

Supporting restaurants in our neighborhood is important, if the were good we would be in once a week. After 3+ bad dining experiences done with dinner or lunch - drinks and apps. only.

Overpriced. Tiny portions. I have never wrote a review but this place was a huge disappointment. I thought since this restaurant had Wolfgang pucks name on the sign I was going experience something special. I felt like I paid a premium for a fancy name on the building and was scammed with mediocre food and high bill. Wolfgang Puck should be ashamed to have his name on this restaurant. The name has lost value with my dinning experience here. If you dine here don't expect anything better then mediocre food with a dive bar dining experience at a high cost.

We eat here several times a week, mostly at lunch during weekdays and for brunch on Sunday.  The hamburgers, french fries and Caesar salad are among the very best in Las Vegas.  Pizza, Chinese chicken salad and many other menu items are absolutely great.  Love the Huevos Rancheros at Sunday brunch are fabulous--though not filiing.  Service is first rate.

The service here is excellent and the food is great.  The Chinese chicken salad is superb.  The ambiance on the patio with the fountain and the music is great.  The lunch menu is very affordable as well.  Check out the free valet if you are stopping by for a bite.

We went for dinner the other night as we had gift cards we had been meaning to use for months. We were impressed the food, the service was friendly. The beer selection is unique. My wife had the pumpkin soup which she really enjoyed. For dinner she had butternut squash tortellini and I ordered the orecchiette pasta. Both were good with fresh tasting pasta and good sauces. The serving sizes are large enough you won't leave starving but will not stuff you. For dessert we shared an apple pastry. The crust was fluffy and the apples were sweet without being over powering. There was a bit of an issue using the gift cards but the manager got it straightened out. It was a nice date night and I would recommend giving it a try.

My husband and I went for lunch today (Sunday at 1:00) to celebrate his birthday and our wedding anniversary.  We waited close to an hour for our food, and in spite of apologies from the waiter, and the excuse that my husbands chicken didn't "look right" and they had to prepare a fresh one, no attempt was made to offer an appetizer or even some bread to hold us over.  The place was packed with staff, yet our waters went empty until we asked for refills.  My husbands 1/2 chicken finally arrived, and for $20.00 I don't think it would kill them to put a few vegetables on the plate.  It was a scrawny (free range apparently) semi dry chicken with three sprigs of dried out rosemary sticking out of it.  The side of mac a cheese (that we had to pay extra for) was also dried out.  My wild mushroom pasta was good.  Lots of mushrooms and al dente, so that might have been worth the $18.00, but for the prices they charge, vegetables, potatoes, a salad, or rice should come with the entrée, and if they're going to take an hour to give people their food, some bread would prevent patrons from knawing off a table leg.  The atmosphere was active and noisy, so the "edgy" music they played was just more noise that wasn't needed.  This particular Pucks is new and in the heart of downtown Summerlin Las Vegas.  This is an upscale area where restaurants are frequented by mostly locals.  We have countless wonderful restaurants at our fingertips, with ambiance, good service, decent portions, and tasty, reasonably priced menu items.  It appears to us that Wolfgang Pucks is counting on the name to carry the restaurant, and the overpriced, stingy portions and bad service will be overlooked.  That might fly on the strip, but it won't fly with the locals.  We will not be back.

BEST KEPT SECRET IN SOUTHERN NEVADA!  As i write this review, i'm torn!  On the one hand, i have been enjoying this spectacular dining experience for weeks, practically by myself and i love it!  I WANT TO KEEP THE SECRET!  On the other hand, i owe the dining public, who appreciate fantastic food opportunities, the opportunity to share in this wonderful dining experience.  I would NOT want anyone to hold out on me, after all.  
If you are fortunate enough to get a spot at Wolfgang Puck's table at this location (this is the brainchild of David Robins) [HINT:  make a reservation] you will be treated to a three course special meal, totally at the discretion of the Chef for $25 including a glass of WP wine plus tip!  On top of this, on the second Tuesday of every month this location offers (generous) free samples of spectacular wine from around the world to all diners in the restaurant plus they bring in an amazing singer with a vast repertoire on those Tuesdays.  
So what do you get for that meager fare - $25?  First they start your off with an amuse bouche - i have had a crab cake, a tomato shooter, tomato basil soup, the whole gambit. Then you get what the Italians would call a secondo piatti, i have had pappardella with a meat sauce that was sublime -- among many others.  Then the "peaches of resistance," comes -- Chef Chris likes to bring this dish out personally in a tajine for the element of surprise -- the three most memorable dishes were two fish dishes, one salmon and another bass and the most amazing was shrimp on a skewer in a curry coconut sauce -- it was so beautiful. They take a real farm-to-table approach with their food -- everything is fresh and tasty and cooked to perfection.  For dessert lovers, they have the most amazing pastry chef that makes some of the best -- homemade chocolate pudding, strawberry shortcake, and the most amazing white chocolate cake with raspberry sorbet!  Again, i hesitate to share this because i ALWAYS WANT my spot at the table.  However, i would be derelict in my duties as a foodie if i did not tell a few others about this amazing feast for a small price for some of the best food in Las Vegas.  You owe it to yourself to treat yourself to this amazing opportunity soon -- i don't know how long this will last, but while it does -- Go FOR IT!
PS they also do the most amazing ribs on the weekend that are, as they say, "to die for."
All horrible   Food a disaster.  Menu reduced. Many good items eliminated.  Love wolfgangs just not here

I ordered their chicken salad sandwich. It was good but disappointed to discover the toasted bread was burnt on one side and was hidden inside the sandwich. I mentioned it to the waitress. Her response was disappointing. She basically confirmed it was burnt. Yeah.. Thanks I can see that.

Open for brunch at 11a but the monkey bread a breakfast staple isn't served till 12p otherwise everything else was delicious again. So if you want bread with your omelette wait till noon. Also of note the omelette says it comes with roasted tomato but it was more like a canned San Marzano chunky tomato delicious but not a grilled tomato. I prefer food to match the description. One last note, the coffee was hot and tasty but the refills were slow in coming a must for breakfast. We hope you improve since we are serious breakfast nuts and love being loyal customers. Your cappuccino is delish!

I would never eat there again. Wanted to try it but was so disappointed. Ordered garlic bread. The bread was about 2 inches wide was $7 cut into 3 tiny pieces. Chicken salad $17 had a few tiny shreds of chicken. Think Wolfgang needs a donation. Cheap bastard. 
Food was not tasty n the portions were measly. Would not recommend anyone going there.

Great location and the same quality quirky but good menu 

Wonderful vibe for a drink or stop before the show

Food-  was decent not nearly As impressive as his other restaurants. Honestly was pretty under whelmed.

The seats were not comfortable slightly and the service was ehhh.  I would suggest going to the red rock casino they have better options that have better service.

Went to dinner there Tuesday night. Even though the place was empty, the hostess seated us right next to the bus station for water service. We asked if we could be seated at quieter table, and the hostess accommodated us. 

Within five minutes, sirens started going off. Flashing lights, klaxons, and a loudspeaker that told us to evacuate the building.  The waiter came to our table, and told us not to worry, they were just testing out the emergency response system. After he left, the loudspeaker again told us to a evacuate the building. It repeated this message at least 40 times.  He said they had to do this because it was a new building.  The alarm was very loud and lasted through the majority of our dining room visit..  

We were given only a feeble apology.  We were never offered a complimentary drink, a complementary appetizer, or a complimentary dessert.

My recommendation to the management is to test equipment before dining service begins.

This is a tough one. Went Friday PM and it was great.. great service and great food.. went again Sunday PM and it was awful. Terrible TERRIBLE service and TERRIBLE FOOD. We will go again and hope for the best because when it was good it was very good. Fingers crossed we won't have to give up on this one.

Food is delicious.  But the service is atrocious and the bartenders need to work on their skills when making cocktails. We have eaten here on a weekly basis for the last several months.  No one knows us and there seems to be a lot of turn over in staff and managers.  Fingers crossed they can pull it together because we really do love the menu.

I dont like giving bad reviews but im sure this isnt going to effect wolfgangs bank account like it would a small business owner.
The seating here is akward. There is normal seating but then u have cafeteria style seating. They sat us there thinking they wont put anyone next to us. They tried to put people next to us and they kept insisting to sit someone else. To start to ordered calamari which was good but very small. A minestrone soup. The broth was good but it seemed like everything else was undercooked. I got the pepperoni pizza and my wife got the steak frittes. She ordered mac n cheese on the side and i got a side of fries w my pizza. I think the bill was over 130 bux. Im not sure what kind of steak it was, it was cut then bad some fries on the side for 35 bux. The fries were good but mcdonalds r the same. The only thing worth getting here was the pizza. Overall, biggest rip off in the world. Worst seating arrangement in the world. Please save ur money. Have the pix u see on yelp do not exist there anymore as they keep changing their menu. Do urself a favor and just get a take out pizza, go home and eat it. Place is just foul

The service was excellent although the woman I was with knows the waiter so I am sure that had something to do with it. 

Oysters- tiny and smelly - $19
Tuna tartare - grey and strong fish smell ( seemed old to me) $19
Pre-made beet salad (not bad - worth $6) $14
Panna water $6.50 a bottle 
Rigatoni (she liked it) I thought it was ok $16
Spaghetti and meatballs- pasta was undercooked and sauce was like spaghetti-O's , meatballs were bland. 
Broccolini- hard and minced like we got leftovers $6

Go to Nora's and save $80 and get real food.  I could see why the restaurant was nearly empty on a Friday evening at 8PM! 

As a bonus my date was served wine in a dirty glass.... The only thing I can't figure out is why I gave it the second star??

This was our first time here and overall it was a very good experience. Food was delicious and service was prompt. Our meal was delivered quick. It seemed like it took only 10 minutes, might be because the place wasn't super busy. Anyway, great place and I would definitely eat here again.

Great spot for brunch! Do not leave until you have the truffled chips with blue cheese fondue! Amazing! My wife ordered the steak and eggs, equally as good. I got the eggs Benedict. If you are a fan of eggs Benedict, definitely try it. Probably the best I've ever had! Overall, if you are in the neighborhood, give it a chance, you won't be disappointed.

The seafood linguini was to die for. Great tasty sauce, and clams were cooked just right. I could taste the ocean.  Can't wait to come back and get the same thing.  
Pretty authentic Italian tomato sauce on the pasta that comes with Chicken Parmigiana. Not a fan of chicken but the pasta was delicious.

Sat in the bar area with a friend and ordered a few things! The charcuterie board came out quick. The meats tasted so fresh! Everyone was so attentive and was always checking up on us. Will be coming back soon.
Gianna was the very best guide to our Wolfgang excursion. She is a doll. Hope you get her!!xxoxoxox

We have been here several times and every time we have a great experience. We came for happy hour the last 2 sautrdays in a row. There drinks are great and they don't skimp on the alcohol either. We tried the Pineapple Mojito and the Margarita, both are very good. The chips and salsa on happy hour is amazing, it taste very fresh. All the food we tried here (Margarita Pizza, Spaghetti and Meatballs, Caesars salad and Mixed Salad) were great. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is that we would not have to ask to get bread and butter before. Now, if you do ask, they certainly we'll bring it to your table, however they don't just offer it by themselves. The chicken wings on happy hour are very very good (twice baked), but for $6 Dollars I think you should get a little more that the 4 they serve you.
They have the best calamari I have even had and I love their atmosphere every time we go there. I also love eating their pizza and they have a great drink menu
food is good.  service is nice.  when the weather is good, dining outside is very pleasant.

Very yummy!!! Came in on a Saturday night and was sat right away! Excellent service and big portions of food. For a starter we had the blue cheese potato chips- so good! With 3 of us eating there was more than enough to share! 

The salmon entree was cooked perfectly and the 2 chicken dishes (Brick Chicken and Chicken Piccata) were delicious and were very full plates of food!!

Carla is amazing! Go see her at the bar and ask for her recommendations! She's skilled, friendly and fast! She's truly an asset to the company and is a reason so many regulars come back time and time again!!

Get the barrel aged Manhattan for your drinks. 

And come for happy hour every day after 3p!!!

For dinner I recommend the Caesar salad: but order it with chicken and have them chop it! Perfect portion!!!

and nachos... Any good place I frequent had a nacho on the menu but the nice happy hour nachos here are AMAZING!! I wish they had a full portion size!! 

I've had lunch, dinner, a corporate dinner and plenty of happy hour visits to this place and it's one of my favorites!! 

Short answer: This place is great!
Love patio seating, great food and service.  Definitely will be dining here again in the future.

Decent food, but nothing awesome. Overpriced in my opinion. The menu is extremely limited -- out of perhaps 10 entrees, three were Italian. Not really a bar and grill. I had the chicken Calabrese ($25) -- two pieces of chicken with a few cherry tomatoes, a couple of tiny grilled onions and peppers in a nice sauce. That was it -- it would've killed them to pipe a few mashed potatoes around the edge? Something more than just chicken in a pan? My friend had fish and chips ($21). Fish was 6-7 smallish pieces, nicely done and the steak fries were yummy.

The service is definitely lacking. We had to ask for the malt vinegar, we had to ask for water refills, and nobody ever came by to say "is everything all right?" This place is definitely bare bones. No bread basket, the entrees don't come with even a basic salad, and there is no salt and pepper on the table. That always irks me as in "the chef knows what he's doing and if you can't appreciate the subtlety of his expertise, you shouldn't be eating here. There's a Denny's down the street, you peasant." 

In reading these reviews, I see there is some kind of Yelp perk, so I would definitely go through them if I ever go back -- which I don't plan to do.

We celebrated a birthday last night and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The variety of offerings worked well with our group of 6.  The calamari was perfect and the grilled lemon half was a plus.  I am not normally a meatloaf lover, but figured "what the heck...it's Puck's".  this was by far the best meatloaf I have ever had.  The flavor was smoky as if it had been cooked in the wood fire pizza oven. It was topped with delicate and crispy onion rings.  We complimented our meal with a 1/2 price bottle of really good wine.  The service was exceptional as well.  Thank you for making our evening so special.

Outstanding lunch! Our party of a dozen people was expertly served by Jason from Delaware. From the rockfish tacos to the Chinese chicken salad to the pumpkin soup (oh and yeah, the Moscow Mules), all we heard around the table were raves. Highly recommend. With so many incredible restaurant choices in LV, we don't often return again and again to a single place. But, here, we'll make the exception and definitely be back
Just want to say Pucks is an amazing place to eat. Sarah the manager and Juan the servers are the best. Great food, at great prices.

I ate at Wolfgangs with my family this week and I have to say I was not impressed. 2 stars for the food, an extra star for the service. Here's what we had
Mushroom pasta with marscapone- the pasta is VERY al dente- all of it! Very little flavor from this dish.. I didn't even eat half of it.
Burger with a marmalade of some kind (only one on the menu)- it was just ok. Burger was cooked perfectly, veggies were fresh and bun was soft but it just wasn't great. 
Mac n cheese- like I said previously, very al dente... Almost crunchy and the cheese sauce was very thin. Topped with bread crumbs though, so that was nice.
Kids cheese pizza- best meal of the table. Crust has a really great sourdough taste and is nice and crispy. 

Service was very personal and very attentive. My server let me try 3 wines before choosing the one I wanted. She also took my uneaten mushroom pasta off of my bill without me asking, which is always nice.

Love this restaurant for delicious salads, drinks ( great happy hour cheap eats and drinks) and the best pizza and mussels around!  This restaurant is an easy fun meeting place for happy hour or dinner. We stop often and always have great service and a quick bite. It's a great mertingbplace in the lounge area, outdoor patio when weather permits, and the restaurant side.  The location is easy to find parking in the side lot plus a great place to stop after shopping.

Worst service ever!!!! No server ever came to take our order after 20 minutes. We told another server and the hostess we were ready; yet they still had us wait forever. Totally unacceptable. The restaurant was not even full or busy. Coming here was a waste of my time and big mistake! They lack customer service and professionalism.
We get the Mexican Street Corn and Crispy Cauliflower sides for Happy Hour!!! Awesome

First time here for dinner. Ian our waiter is new to the restaurant, but he knew wverything on the drink and food menu. 5 yelp stars for Ian (soelling might be off). Best thing was that he was only familiar with the yelp check in promo at Spago, but he asked his manager about the yelp checkin at Wolfgang summerlin and figured it out promptly. 

He recommended the old fashioned, i like old fashioned's and enjoyed the flavor of their version. A little bit on the sweeter side, but a great way to introduce a girl to the classic bourbon drink. 

Starters we had happy hour appetizers which are every day from 3-7pm. Yay for extended happy hour time! We had the calamari and chicken nachos. Everything came out hot and cooked perfectly.

Entrees we had the braised short rib, brick chicken, and the rigatoni. Very delicious
Short rib was super tender, very tasty and the mashed potato was wonderfully seasoned.
I didn't try my friend's chicken, but they said it was very good, not dry. Just noce and juicy. My rigatoni pasta was a little undercooked, was a little salty, but with a little bit of the cheese, it cuts the saltyness. One little downside didn't hurt my experience at all. 

Dessert was red velvet cheesecake, it had a nice dark chocolate mousse between he cheesecake and the red velvet crust.

20% off with Yelp checkin. Food was tasty, but a bit pricey compared to others in Downtown Summerlin so the Yelp discount was appreciated! Next time I'm trying happy hour, 3-7 daily. Dog friendly patio outside the bar!

This has been one of my favorite restaurants to go to. My boyfriend and I come every other week and so - sometimes we sit at the kitchen table, there is really great energy watching the chef and cooks making the food and bantering back and forth. Overall the food is amazing- the Chinese chicken salad and Prosciutto Pizza are "MUST HAVE" dishes. I would also add the Truffle Potato chips are to die for, but an infrequent guilty pleasure. My boyfriend and I got seated with the server James our first time and really such a nice guy and great service... we request him every time and we started picking up his historical mantra "I'm killing it" around the house. Automatically when we come in he knows what we want or will suggest good specials. One night my boyfriend and I came to Wolfgang feeling kinda down from a long day and we left feeling uplifted with huge smiles on our faces, thanks to James! The whole staff is super nice and the food comes quick. So happy to speak on both of our behalf that Wolfgang has become a family ritual.
Nice happy hour with a decent selection of alcohol and food items.  Service was good, but went downhill after it got busy.  Wait staff had to be helped by management for basic seating.

Great atmosphere, friendly service.... But the food was average at best and overpriced.... Made a reservation... Got there a little early... It was crowded so had to wait about 30 minutes anyway.... Order a bottle of wine, Malbec, they were out and had to settle for second choice... Ordered the short rib and had to settle for second choice again... Ordered the Strip steak medium rare.... It came out well done and had to send it back... Brownie dessert was as if from a school cafeteria... I wanted to work with them on this but there was no soft landing on this almost $300 dinner for five...

Staff is always attentive and never let my drinks go untopped!  The food is very fresh...especially the pasta dishes.  Request the bread it is warm and tasty.  Always check out the rotating dessert menu...if you have a sweet tooth.  It won't disappoint. Great rustic and mid century modern decor.
Tiffany and Augi are amazing. The service is amazing, food, is good, drinks are great.  We love to come here with our dog and visit with the staff. I would recommend to all.

My friend and I came here today between the brunch time and lunch time. The service we received on this particular occasion was bad, however the food was delicious I normally order the salmon dish they have but it is not offered during brunch so I got a salad. My friend ordered the minestrone soup and that was amazing we both loved it. Although the server we had was bad, the manager came over and talked to us about our experience which we really appreciated.

We have been coming here since it opened, and it used to be really really great. Our last two experiences here, however, have left alot to be desired. The service was painfully slow, a meal that should have taken no more than an hour or so dragged on for over two hours. Most of that time was spent t waiting, drinks were never refilled, in fact my boyfriend waited for so long for a refill that all of the ice in his glass had melted and he drank that until empty. We ordered dessert and the salted caramel ice cream was so salty that all 3 people at the table agreed it was completely inedible.

I could go in to more detail on how atrocious our service was, but truly I feel that I don't want to waste more of my time on this place. Suffice it to say, we wont be back.

So glad we tried this place out! Their Wolfgang Puck Pinot Noir was a great start and the salt and pepper chicken wings were so different and a great appetizer. Being from Buffalo, it was disappointing they didn't have Blue Cheese but our waiter made something similar happen! The prosciutto and fig pizza was 5/5 (+ ricotta cheese), chicken parm was lacking a bit of flavor but still good. We will be back for the pizza and wings!
Calamari with shisito peppers- delicious. I had the brick chicken - great flavor and cooked well. Generous wine pours, too! Excellent service and lively atmosphere.

Bad experience, ordered 1/2 chicken for $25 & it was the smallest chicken I ever seen maybe the size of 1/4 . Comes with no sides, so I ordered a side (they forgot to put in in) . I left hungry after spending a $125 for 3 people.
Never will go back.

It's always good when I come and service is consistent. I can appreciate consistency and efforts in service. If I ask for a recommendation it's always given from the servers perspective and taste pallet. The mac n cheese is great. We have been a few times and each time I was satisfied.

We went here on 2/25 during a shopping session in Downtown Summerlin. We were promptly greeted and seated. The waiter Juan also greeted us quickly for our drink orders. We had never been to any of Wolfgang's places and were very impressed. I ordered the cheeseburger (with bacon) and fries. My wife ordered one of three daily specials-turkey burger with fries. Both of us have never had a tastier burger than here. Waiter Juan consistently checked back on us and refilling our drinks. I would not hesitate to return to this classy place!!

I came in for dinner with my boyfriend and there was no wait. We received our appetizer, but waited and waited for our meal.  The tables sat after us received their dinners as our waitress brought us steak knives in preparation for our meal.  We waited more and more, and didn't see our waitress for quite some time.  Finally she stopped by to let us know that there was an error and they had not yet started our meal, but that they could start it for us now.  We had been there over an hour and declined because we had other plans to attend to.  She returned and told us there wasn't a bill to pay, the drinks and appetizer were taken care of.  The manager never made an appearance, but had to have been aware if the meal was comped.  When you go to a restaurant, you usually go to eat a meal.  When the only job they really have doesn't get fulfilled, it's generally managements job to handle customer relations.  I found it very odd and unwelcoming the manager didn't at least stop by and acknowledge that we never received our dinners...at least the waitress was lovely.

I've been here for lunch, dinner and happy hour many times as it's practically next door to my place.   Really comfortable for a casual night out. 

I've always had good food and good service both at the bar and in the restaurant.  Some notables on the menu are the charcuterie board, mushroom pizza, steak frites, and chicken salad sandwich. 

The menu changes up every few weeks, and everything is pretty solid except a few of the happy hour menu items which tend to be overly salty and fatty.

Lunch today, very pleasant environment and very good service~
  Nice to be at a mall and not to have that crappy mall fast food choice. Downtown Summerlin has excellent option for food, drinks etc. 
   Lunch today was a Cuban Sandwich~ quite DEELISH. The roll was crunchy but not so hard it scraped the roof of my mouth and all the other elements sliced pork, ham, cheese & pickles grilled perfectly~ did not indulge in a cocktail this afternoon, however they offer great selections. The Arnold Palmer sufficed with the tropical tea it was a nice alternative~
    If your out & about this is a GR8 option so don't pass on Wolfgang.....he knows what he's doing!

A new branch in downtown Summerlin. We sat outside and the waiter is very attentive. The steak is tender and juicy and the red snapper is cooked to perfection, not dry at all. It was not so busy and it's good for celebrating birthday or occasion. I haven't tried any other food but the snapper and steak and so far it is delicious. Ask the waiter to take few photos of you or group and they will gladly do it. Definitely a place to go back to.

It is nice to have a Wolfgang Puck restaurant in Downtown Summerlin! I have a couple favorites on Wolfgang's menu that had me driving to the strip locations for years.

This restaurant has an nice contemporary but cabin feel with their large wooden doors, wood interior, brown placemats and hand blown water glasses. This is an upscale indoor/outdoor dining restaurant with room for social events. But, you don't want to be sitting in the seating adjacent to the social event room during an event. It has sliders that do not buffer the noise. Trust me, I know.

Since they opened, I have probably patronized the restaurant five-six times as recently as yesterday for lunch. My favorite salad is Wolfgang's classic Chinois salad. Recently, Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill has reverted to calling it simply the Chinese Chicken Salad. Apparently, the word "Chinois" was too complicated to say for our diverse population. My teenage son really enjoys having the mesquite-grilled burger with fries. He says the meat is juicy and flavorful while the bun doesn't get soggy during the meal. I usually steal some of his delicious fries - they are super good.

One thing that set's this restaurant aside besides the atmosphere is the creative extra touches. I really enjoy having iced tea at this restaurant because of the flavor and cool iced tea cubes instead of just ice chips or ice cubes. Also, the menu is not overwhelming and changes by the month/season. They use fresh vegetables and fruits from the local Summerlin Farmer's Market wherever possible. 

My only disappointment would be the fresh blackberry cobbler. Although it has a great flavor, it is too thin and the crust is more like a crumb topping. If you like vanilla ice-cream on your cobbler, it quickly overwhelms the portion of cobbler.  I have had some amazing cobblers over the years - even by Wolfgang and this was not the one!

The customer service has always been awesome, and I do enjoy this restaurant. I look forward to tasting more creations at this location in the upcoming months and years.
This is a hidden gem in downtown Summerlin.  I've never had a bad meal here.  It's a chill spot, great, moderately priced food.  Simple menu, and very friendly staff.  You can thank me later.

This place is wonderful. The food was excellent and our server knew how to pair the wines and rosè with the food. Everything tasted wonderful. They kept my glass full and my stomach also with great appetizers and hearty servings in their main dishes even though I had my daughter with me and she made a mess. I made sure to clean it up. We also sat outside because I know she tends to be a wild one. They even accommodated to my daughter's palette as well, serving us some cauliflower tots.
My only negative comment is that they asked to box up the rest of my food and they ended up tossing everything away. We bought a lot of food and I'm disappointed that my money went to waste.
Service was good, unfortunately the food was not. Very disappointed, will not be back. For the price the food was lacking.

Ordered my burger medium & it came out very very close to well.  Thank god it had a shit load of sauce on it.  Still I expected a lot better from their cooks.  You shouldn't be able to survive only on a chef name.  You should have to produce.

Our party of 5 went for a dual birthday celebration and the entire staff was superb and the drinks and food were amazing! Our server provided excellent recommendations. Thank you for taking such good care of us and keep up the fantastic work!!

This is probably not my favorite steakhouse in town. I understand that going to downtown summerlin, moreover to a Wolfgang Puck restaurant that I will be paying for a premium but premium service and food should be expected as well. Paying $24 for a salad and $10 more to add a couple strips of chicken so thin that my girlfriend begins to become impressed with me is blasphemous. Once again moreover, asking politely to our server who will not be named (Isaac) responds with "Yup" after everything isn't just rude but really annoying. If my previously mentioned girlfriend wanted to here yup from someone after every question; we would've stayed at home and she could've asked me to do work around the house. Next time I go to Wolfgang Puck's restaurant I expect to get fisted from him personally instead of the service and prices for those services. 
Restaurant is pretty clean though.

Great food 
Great prices
Half price on bottle of wine for dinner
Fish and chips was really good. Yum yum
Nice and lively atmosphere.  Fish delicious, caesar chicken salad so so.

We specifically went here for a nice lunch because I figured they would have gluten free pizza, being a popular pizza spot, and because the beet salad is a favorite from the south coast plaza, CA location that I frequent. Sadly, there was no GF pizza and the 14.00 beet salad was pathetic. There were maybe 6 beats on a plate with a tiny sprig of greens on top!  In Costa Mesa, CA it's a lunch size salad with a plate full of salad, lots of beats on top and it's great!  When I mentioned in shock to the server that the salad was very weak and much different from the other location, she said "well that's how we do it here!"  We were all in shock. It was at best a tiny appetizer portion. The service was slow and very mediocre. Would never go back!

This was our first time here. It looked pretty fancy but we had a coupon so we went in. We were seated right away and our server was James. He was amazing. He was polite and funny and just the right amount of attentive. The food came in record time and was delicious! Those meatballs are to die for! The cranberry berry mojito was really good. The food that took the longest was the lava cake, but it was worth every second! We will be back and bringing people with us! Loved it!

Straightforward - Great food, Awesome service, late night coctails white wine sagria is my way to end a great night.  If your in the mood for a tasty pasta spaghetti with meatballs this is one stop to do. My picture should sum it all for to you.

Had a great dinner at this awesome location in downtown summerlin. 

I highly recommend the chopped salad, and their pizzas have the gluten free option! 

Wine is also half off Monday -Thursday! 

The service was on point and we had a lovely time.

we have been there 2 times food and service is very good. but the waiter failed to tell us that the flank steak salad for the lunch special that he told us about was $33. For a lunch salad with steak. Totally unexceptionable. Not sure we will be back anytime soon.

The food here is extremely excellent. It was told to me that it is farm to table, so the freshness is there. We started with the chicken wings which were delicious. The buffalo sauce tasted like it was prepared in house. 
I had the chicken under a brick, which was prepared perfectly. Roasted vegetables to boot. 
My dining partner had the short rib bowl, with a side of kimchi. 
We finished with the key lime cupcake and creme brûlée.
Everything came out time and got off the stove.  Thumbs up!

Food was great! Service not so much. Server was not paying any attention to us. Came to our table twice and hasn't refilled our water glasses since we've been here. We've been waiting for him to come to our table just so we can ask for our check its been 20 min!

I picked this spot for a dinner with a coworker after she requested a place in the downtown Summerlin area. I got a bad feeling when I looked over their menu and nothing interested me, but I was confident that the several positive reviews from friends would yield a good experience.

Started with a glass of the Wolfgang Puck Cab, $9 and delicious, as well as the truffle chips with bleu cheese fondue. The truffle was a little overstated but the fondue had good flavor- too bad the order was cold. 

Coworker ordered the brick chicken and broccoli, while I chose the tortilla soup and roasted squash. Neither of us were wowed, food was very generic. I can't help but think I ordered wrong, but nothing stood out on the menu and even looking through reviews and photos now, the pizza that gets the best reviews (potato and leek with proscuitto?) is no longer available.

I decided to try something new today and ended up here! Overall the experience was good! The menu was small and simple. The restaurant looked beautiful inside and was very inviting I loved that you could see the kitchen. I loved he wood door. I ordered the Chinese Chicken Salad and loved every single bite. Chicken was so tender and juicy and the cashews and wontons were perfect. Also we ordered the fish and chips. Fries were seasoned to perfection and fish was crispy and good! The only thing that would have made this better was the service! It wasn't anything to complain about I just would have expected more with such great food for high prices.
One of my favorite places in Summerlin. Great food and service. On nice days, sit on the patio.

Margerita pizza & crispy fries to go were excellent. Only complaint was the unusually small drink, it wasn't worth the money. Fries were actually crispy but pop em in the toaster oven or regular oven if you like them reaaally crispy!

I was pleasantly surprised at how good this place was. A lot of restaurants trade on the name of a famous chef but don't deliver the quality. Cut, however, is one of my favorite places in Vegas so I was willing to give this place a chance, and it delivered. 

First, i would suggest a reservation as its usually pretty busy. In fact before I got in I tried to make a res on 2-3 other nights and they were fully booked. I think that has died down a bit now that its been open for a while but its still pretty busy.

Second, I thought the service was great. One small example- as a manly man I am not a big fan of "splitting" entrees, there are few things more emasculating than admitting to a server you can't finish the arugula Caesar salad on your own. When I went here I got talked into splitting Steak Frites with someone and as embarrassing as that could have been they brought it already divided on 2 separate plates and gave each of us a monster portion of fries that allowed me to leave with some small semblance of my dignity in tact. Its the little things. The steak was good, but the fries were amazing- I know I know how good could regular fries be? Turns out pretty good. 

Third, Location- its past the movie theater and close to CREAM. There isn't a lot of parking immediately around it though. Having never been to downtown Summerlin I asked a few people for directions and they were all pretty inaccurate. 

If I HAD to come up with a criticism I would say that the App section is a little lackluster.

A quaint place to meet for lunch. I sat at the bar and started out with a cup of butternut squash and tortilla soup. I had the WP burger with caramelized onions and cheddar cheese.  The restaurant fills up pretty fast around noon time...so get there a little early before the rush !!!

Food was good but over priced. 

Came in after shopping in the area, was seated immediately but our server took quite a while to greet us and get us water. Had to wait awhile for re-fills too. But they were under-staffed, she wasn't being lazy or un-attentive, she just had too many tables. Long story short, food was really good but too expensive for the portion and the average ingredients. 

My friend got the seafood pasta which came with very little pasta and a few shrimp and small scallops and clams. Sauce was average and nothing amazing. My pasta was really good, but again, too expensive for what it was. The potato chips with blue cheese and truffle oil was really good. $9 for a bowl of chicken tortilla "broth" was not worth it - Yard House has way tastier chicken tortilla soup. 

Thank goodness for the 20% off when you check-in on Yelp...still not worth it even after the discount.

Dining at Wolfgang Puck was a very pleasant experience. Our waiter James was excellent and made recommendations for my wife and I as it was our first time dining there. The calamari was excellent and our main dishes were delicious as well. James kept my cup full of the Moscow mules. We will definitely return.

I sat up at the bar and ordered a Manhattan, a side of potatoes, and the ahi tuna appetizer. All were very delicious. It was expensive, but not overwhelmingly so for Vegas. The only thing I'd say about this experience was that it was very clear to me that all of the bartenders were about to get off shift...and were making their anticipation/happiness of this very evident to everyone. If you dont want to be there, I dont want to hear it.

I wanted to try something new for Mother's Day and I chose this restaurant for its brand name. I had the pasta with veggies, it was delicious and fresh tasting. Mimosa was free. Server was polite and checked up on us. They got kids menu, my son had the burger and my toddler had the grilled cheese, with the price they could've at least include drinks with it. I don't think I would come back to this restaurant though because of the limited choices on the menu. They didn't even have a Mother's Day special, might as well have gone to craves next door or CPK.

It's located at the heart of downtown summerlin, great location but average food quality. Service was okay. We ordered mussels in white wine sauce might be the best of all, the rest was not too impressive. Have tried few Wolfgang's restaurants in town, I think the receipt are very standard, I'd much rather give Loco chef a try!
8 min until the bar tender even ask if I wanted something to drink. Then he was rude and used profanity.

Chinois Chicken Salad is a little spicy, but not over the top. Very fresh & zesty with nice fresh carrot & cashews which make it very interesting! 

The Tequilla Sunrise is great, if only they would offer Alien Tequilla. The smoothest Tequilla in the Universe. 

Calamari just came ... It is soft, not rubbery and the green & red sauces are both delightful. 

On to the burger, it comes out exactly as you order it... Cartelized onions... What a great burger. Wolfgang is a 10 as usual.

This is a happy hour review. 

The Skinny: overpriced portions for happy hour review and with the exception of the calamari wouldn't order anything else again(3), service: pretty good in the bar area (4), value: pass -  there are better places to spend your hard earned cash (3).

After purchasing some Wolfgang Puck gift cards from Costco (protip: $100 gift card for $79.99 - this is an online deal only), we still had some money leftover from a visit to Spago. So we decided to hit this place for happy hour and use up the rest of it. 

The happy hour food menu consists of truffled potato chips with Maytag blue cheese fondue, cheese plate,  charcuterie plate, chicken wings,  fried calamari,  meatballs,  and pork tacos -  each dish is priced at $6.

We placed an order for the chicken wings, the calamari,  the meatballs, and the pork tacos. The hubs raised an eyebrow but I told him I didn't think the portion sizes were going to be big. 

Boy was I right! We spent $24 on 2 small meatballs, 4 chicken wings, 2 bite sized tacos and calamari that I could probably fit in 1 cupped hand.

But are the prices worth it? The magic 8 ball says no. 

The meatballs were okay but the marinara was overly sweet. The pork tacos didn't have that robust porkiness and was relatively bland even with the salsa. The chicken wings were nothing no to write home about and the mild Asian hot sauce didn't really distinguish itself in any particular way. 

The best thing was by far the calamari. The batter was perfect and light. We loved the green ginger flavored aioli it came with. 

Service was excellent with a full bar area and our water glasses were never empty. 

Given what we sampled today, I would be hard pressed to return. The portion sizes for the price/quality is pretty ridiculous. 3 starred review.

There are so many choices for restaurants in downtown Summerlin, but Wolfgang Puck stands out as our number one choice all the time. We live the food here, the quality is top notch and the service is always genuine and friendly. My daughter loves the spaghetti meatballs from the kids menu which has a very good variety as well. They have great pizzas, amazing fish and really good hamburger too. We always order the homemade potato chips with blue cheese, it's addictive! If you like Mexican flavors you can always find a good option on the menu as well, I love to start off with the tortilla soup, it's delicious. Overall, this is a great restaurant to bring your family for a nice meal and I highly recommend seating outside in the patio area when the weather is favorable.

The most over-priced salad (16.00) for 1.5 cups of greens and 3 oz of chicken. when I commented the server got surly, offered to bring me more, but never did.
Tables are so close together, you feel like your neighbors can hear your every word. 
Out on this place.

The good - Bloody Mary was excellent, Desserts were very good, burgers good 

The bad - we had a group of 9 for a birthday event, reservations made 2 weekus prior to visit based on the menu that was online up until today.  Got down, sat and looked at the menu and it was pared down greatly.  All of us had looked at the menu in advance, knew what they were interested in and were disappointed that it wasn't available.   

Since we were 9, with gifts, it was difficult to choose to leave to go elsewhere although it was contemplated.   

Lots of what I had wanted was available at Happy Hour, but that wasn't until 3 and we were there at 1.  No notification of the change until we all sat down and looked at the menu.  Hmm they had my phone #...we picked the restaurant due to the diverse items on the menu...well that diversity was gone.   Waiter was good but stretched thin since he was also working outside.  Normally our group  has at least 2 or 3 beverages each, only had 1 due to inattentiveness to our party.  Took a long time to get the drinks, and, when ordering apps, had to ask for plates for sharing, had to ask for salt and pepper.  The caprese wasn't what was expected, which was ok but the tomatoes had the roots in it, too much radiccio in the Chinese chicken salad so it made it bitter tasting.   

We made them aware of our disappointment and the waiter tried to appease and was going to get the manager....he came back out, said we'll give you 20% off.  It was nice but still we didn't see the manager.  

Our brunch ended with 3 free desserts for our birthdays (there were 2 of us celebrating) which was a surprise and well received but again, no plates to share so it was truly 'family style'.   I almost didn't write this due to the desserts and no sign of the manager.  

We expected more in service and variety for the price we paid and were very disappointed.  With many places to choose from in Downtown Summerlin we wanted to try someplace new based on the menu that was published prior to today.   Sad, that they didn't think enough of a group of people, who made a reservation, to let them know of the drastic change.   And it was  interesting that it wasn't that busy when we were there but at 3 pm when the menu had the variety I was looking for - wings, chicken nachos, it got really busy.   

We will not be back....but do appreciate the discount and desserts and tipped the waiter based on the service not based on the management decision.   He tried, management should have presented themselves.  I wouldn't patronize this establishment again.  I was going to give it 2 stars due to the desserts and discount but a place with the Wolfgang Puck name should have done better.

Wolfgang Puck's off-strip venture is huge, delicious, and so Summerlin. We started the evening with drinks. I had the red sangria, which was good--a tiny bit too sweet--but not so sweet to stop me from drinking three of them over the course of dinner. My boyfriend and I split the calamari for an appetizer, and it was good. I don't remember it too specifically now, so it definitely wasn't the best I've ever had, but I remember thinking it was good at the time. 

For an entree, I had the spaghetti and meatballs. So good. So so so so tasty. The sauce was perfect and there was just the right amount to balance the flavor of the pasta and the meatballs. Two of our dinner companions also had pasta dishes, and they were part of the clean plate club that night. My boyfriend had steak frites. I stole a french fry, and it was crispy, well-seasoned, and hot, as it should be. 

I gave it four stars instead of five because the service was good, but not great. Make a reservation if you go because all of Summerlin has found this place!
Relaxing atmosphere happy hour 3pm till close everyday which is a plus.   Nice selection of pizza and pasta.   Friendly staff and a nice location to have dinner. High recommend

Had an excellent lunch today in Downtown Summerlin at Wolfgang Puck. Upon arrival they were pretty busy but we were greeted with a warm welcome and seated promptly. We were able to enjoy a scenic, peaceful view and ambiance while we dined on the patio. Definitely recommend the truffle chips w maytag blue cheese and  shishito peppers with yuzu to start and the apple crostada to end. I was able to enjoy their special of the day which was a chicken salad sandwich with cranberry walnut bread and sprouts, amazing! Wolfgang yet again ceases to amaze!

I think we got to the restaurant when the shift change was happening, a first server came to our table and asked us for our drink order and if we had questions about the menu, she never came back. 

Later, a second server came in to take our drink order again, our drinks took well over 15 minutes to get there, mind you, restaurant was empty.

Food was decent but service was very lackluster, non attentive and going through the motions. Hopefully it was just a bad night.

We'll think about it twice before coming back.

Wolfgang Puck always been fan of in general. Lately seems like every "star" celebrity chef opens up different concept restaurants under the same name. It was my first time at his Bar & Grill concept restaurant. I have been to Spago and couple other ones. I have never had bad experience but times that just been ok. Bar & Grill fell under the ok. The potato chips with the blue cheese sauce or creamy goodies on top. Perfect combination! The only thing that would have stopped me from raving about it. The worst thing could do with potato chips thin sliced deep fried to order is getting lump of chips. Not individual nicely fried chips that take time drop them in the fryer or move it around rather then dump bunch in walk away. The combination solid. The Creamy Mac 'n' Cheese truffle crumbs. If there was one five star that stole the show was this dish. It not often rave about mac and cheese. I love love the fact that not super thick cheesy but nice creamy. You can taste the hint of truffle in the cheese and still has rich body from the cheese. The pasta not elbow variety but more Orecchiette style. Nice cause in each bite get full effect of sauce, pasta, and the truffle crumbs on top. Winnah. If I could order full size then appetizer I would be all over that pasta. 

I ordered the Orecchiette Pasta, Italian Sausage, Cherry Tomato, Broccolini, fine herbs for my entree.  It was ok. The sauce was more light butter/cream sauce. It liked. It had ample and equal amounts of everything else. I also tried the calamari. Nothing special just ordinary calamari. It was Ohana family dinner so tried piece of my brother entree the grilled flat iron steak. Nothing stood out about that dish for me. Overall really ok no WoW factor or something that would make me want come running back again. 

The service was awesome. The hostess that seated us, our waitress, and later management came checked make sure everything was good. All five star service without doubt for me. Friendly, attentive, and made the dining experience great one! 

The interior decor is interesting. It open kitchen, You have almost chefs bar counter area right in front that can sit down eat. It good spot if dining alone. They have bunch of televisions in the restaurant keep you update on sports. The bar area once walk in on your left like the set up. It one long counter but like the design. Again got couple wide screens with games on watch over some drinks and conversations with friends. 

It in great location in Downtown Summerlin.

I've lunched here twice -- the first time was fantastic the second was marginal. Both times I had the salmon, which was good, as was the white bean ragout, green bean, and tomato side. This time there were some unidentifiable plants mixed in with the arugula salad. 
One in our party sent the Chinese chicken salad back -- it was more of a spicy slaw with a chicken garnish than the entree salad with a protein serving we had on our first visit. The waiter was gracious with the substitute, but it throws off the timing of a meal to wait for a replacement.

Bad. Second time is the last time.   Our first visit was a few months ago and indecision brought us back after a lackluster first experience. We shared the homemade chips with blue cheese dip on visit numerous uno. They weren't great, the "dip" was more like old mayo in a bowl with a sprinkle of blue cheese.

This visit was worse, I ordered the chopped vegetable salad with chicken. In my opinion 22.00 for a small salad with carrots, celery and a few tomatoes is absurd.  The chicken didn't actually come on my salad, I had to ask for it showed up  third of the way into brunch.  My boyfriend ordered the wolf "Mac" muffin. Greasy, gross and child size. Also, comes with no sides so after adding avocado he paid 16.00 for a sandwich that he could have gotten at McDonald's for a dollar.

Service was not great, our waiter disappeared and we basically were shuffled through the rest of the servers. When our server shows back up he refilled my mimosa and hanged me a soaking wet glass with a "sorry" about spilling juice and bubbles all over it. This is a non issue, people spill things but at 80.00 for brunch the service should be close to impeccable.
DTS salad is amazing! I also enjoy the chips with blue cheese. Food is a little pricey but it's pretty good and this place has a great atmosphere.

They like to switch orders with out telling their customers   Blindly but reluctantly admitted by staff. Spoke to Manager Reyes.  Sea Bass is different from Atlantic stripe bass.  Very bad for their reputation. Embarrassing for the industry .

Great outdoor seating and enjoyed the best mushroom and leek flatbread. Flatbread was super soft and piping hot. Great service and prices are reasonable considering the quality of food and the Wolfgang brand. 
Second time dining and have now included it in my dining rotation choices.

I love this place because it's close to my house and the food is good! Service is good...drinks are good...shout out to Bri! It's also very quick you can be in and out which is nice. Staff is friendly and quick to deliver that mouth watering salmon pizza to your table

We went here for dinner this evening. We were a party of seven. We were seated at two tables, one of which was incredibly small. The $5 mai tai's were good. The food was just ok. Nothing spectacular. The burgers came with frozen fries. I would expect a Wolfgang restaurant to use fresh. I had the Chinese chicken salad which was quite tasty but a small portion for $16 not to mention it only had five to six minuscule pieces of chicken. My husband had the salmon. An approximately 4 oz piece served with a large amount of leafy greens for $27. The portion for rigatoni bolognese was a small portion as well for the $22 charged.  The portion sizes are disproportionate to the cost. The service wasn't anything special either. It was slow and our server wasn't very attentive to our party. She was tending the bar as well. Unfortunately, we won't be going back. Just all around lack luster food and just ok service.

Only opened for a week & everything was wonderful. My husband started with the Shrimp Cocktail served with "6" giant pieces & I ordered the Caesar Salad which was very fresh & had a bit of a kick to the dressing.
Ask for bread, it's a doc acid soaked in evoo & a touch of salt...yummy!
We shared a Margarita pizza...LOVED it & I'm a NY Pizza Snob.
Finally we ordered the Brownie Sundae & they swapped the ice cream to Chocolate for me!
Service was AMAZING, our server & buser were adorable...
To finish a great meal, Mr Puck walked in!

Our waiter, Ricky, was genuinely friendly and very attentive. It was my first time and Mom's first time at this hot spot, both of us coming out of the meal with great memories. Our visit was right before closing time but Ricky never left us feeling neglected or unwanted.

Pepperoni pizza and soft, fresh baked chocolate chip cookies were all flavorful masterpieces, but the service will definitely have us returning.

Wolfie always sets the standard. 
Great food great service a very fair price how can you ask for more.

Summerlin's best new restaurant. A great addition to the food scene on the far west side. Good menu, comfort food, well prepared and with the usual attentive service that defines Puck restaurants. Will definitely be back again and again.

Took my family here for Mother's Day for dinner and our first time here. We were seated and waited for at least 25 minutes for a waiter to attend to us. We noticed that other families were being seated and served promptly. We didn't  get served or asked what drinks to serve. We decided to leave and I asked for a manager. I spoke to her about the lack of service even though we were there before most families coming. hostess even said she saw us waiting she never went to get us a waiter? Wtf? U got to be kiddin me. Manager apologized, and asked me what could she do? Why don't you tell me what could you do for us?! You're the manager! Disappointed with the lack of service.

The man that sat us was very friendly. We've heard great things about the pizza we were going to order but unfortunately we didn't get to try anything because we were never greeted, a server never came to our table. After we sat there for at least 10 minutes we got up and left. It wasn't even busy

This weekend we went to Wolfgang Summerlin on Saturday for lunch and back on a Sunday for brunch.  Sorry no pics of lunch on Saturday (we were starving and I forgot to take pics).  However, lunch Saturday is what brought us back for brunch on Sunday and I preferred the Saturday lunch over the Sunday brunch.  Saturday we ordered the Orecchiette (sausage and broccolini) and the chicken salad sandwich. Both were awesome and would definitely go back for and reorder.  The chicken salad sandwich came on a bread with fruit and nuts in it and was awesome!  Sprouts, golden raisins, grapes, almonds so great!  Nice bathrooms, food size bar, and on Saturday they sell fresh bread to take home. 

Sunday we had brunch pics to follow. We had the turkey burger, the stuffed berry French toast, and the charcuterie plate.  There was a lamb chopper cheese on the charcuterie plate that was really tasty and the prosciutto was good quality.  The turkey burger was a solid burger with pepper jack and fresh veg toppings (yum).  The French toast was ok.  It's a bit heavy but not to sweet.  The fresh fruit on top was a great addition (unlikely to reorder the french toast). But would maybe opt for the waffle instead.  

Overall price point for quality was great.  And lunch there will happen again soon.

We stopped by to try their Oktoberfest promotion for dinner and it was an overall tasty experience.  We pretty much ordered everything off of the Oktoberfest menu and were not disappointed!  We started with the freshly baked German pretzel and the meat and cheese board, the latter of which had a nice selection of artisan cheese and the meats were great.  For our mains, I had the schnitzel and my wife had the spicy goulash, both of which were really delicious.  The schnitzel was pounded out flat and was a ginormous portion.  We finished the meal by sharing the German chocolate cake.  Crazy delicious!!!!

It was only our second time at this location and it was well worth it.  Food was great and the service was excellent - a really friendly and attentive staff!  Highly recommended!

Our waitstaff was amazing. Good people...attentive and friendly.
The place itself is pretty cute and comfy. We came early and, except for eating at Wolfgang Puck's at some airports, this was my first time here.
Wolfgang Puck is an icon. He is known for his food and creating innovative dishes. Since that is the case, and that was my expectation, why is the menu so boring?
The same-old appetizers that everyone else has plus the same-old pizzas, burgers, salads, and pasta.
We had - 
Wife had wine...I had beer...and...
Appetizer - Buffalo Blue Tator Tots (needed more bacon...maybe some jalapenos)
Black Bean Soup (excellent!...could have been a little spicier)
Wife had the Chopped Chicken Ceasar (same as everyone else's)
I had the Salume/Jalapeno Pizza (This was tasty...but not mind-numbingly good)

If your name is Wolfgang Puck...I would have thought that the food would be as impressive as the reputation. (and don't make me ask for salt and pepper shakers...put them on the damn table)

Not a bad place...just a place.

I Never have written a review for any restaurants in Las Vegas, or any where for that matter.
My Girlfriend who is in remission from Cancer and this was her first outing, she decided she wanted to try this place out. When we arrived we were greeted by the "hostess" and I use that term very loosely because a hostess is the first one to make the experience great. She sat us down near the kitchen, now please keep in mind my friend is very sensitive to smells unfortunately , and the smell was an over powering fish smell that was coming from the kitchen. So we asked if we can move (and pointed to another table that was vacant) to another table, she said no. Then we asked again if its possible to be moved to any other table that wasn't near the kitchen , and when I tell you there were many open tables, she stated again "no" and not in a kind way of any manner. 
Unfortunately we never were able to try the food because the "customer service" that wasn't  available, when we walked she clearly saw us and smirked and giggled under her breath. I would never go back just because of the rudeness of staff, and would recommended several of the other restaurants in downtown Summerlin.

On a cloudy, cold & windy afternoon, we booked it from the opposite side of Downtown Summerlin to Wolfgang Puck. Walking in was heavenly!... warm with the cozy smell of fire. Our waitress was friendly & tolerant of our questions & requests (we've all been that customer!) & always smiled. We ordered the chicken salad sandwich with the bread not toasted, the steak salad & the mac & cheese. Our food took a while & my partner in crime was getting agitated... but then it came &, upon the 1st bite of mac & cheese, all was forgiven. It was the mac & cheese that dreams are made of. Literally perfection. The chicken salad sandwich was both savory & sweet... also amazing. The only critique was that the bread was almost too hearty/tough. Otherwise, what was referred to as a "special" should be permanent! The flank steak in the salad, even well done, was succulent. The salad was delicious but the dressing wasn't creamy/thick enough to hold up to the salad's substance (even asking for extra dressing didn't help). It was a very pleasant experience that we're looking forward to immersing ourselves in again.

It was disgusting that one of the staff members had huge freaking holes in his ear lobes. the menu had a horrible variety. my wife and I got up and decided not to order and instead we went to the Distilled restaurant which exceeded our expectations. 

The positive thing about the Wolf Gang was the environment and ambience did look nice and the staff was also very nice. However my wife was very disappointed with a menu. it was not expensive however.

This used to be my spot but now it's no longer the place for me. The happy hour used to be until they close but now it's only from 3-7pm and they've removed some items off of their happy hour menu....total bummer! And the service used to be spectacular but my service yesterday was mediocre. Our server checked on us twice and half assed it the entire time mind you the bar was NOT busy! She gave the other couple at the bar her attention. The manager got wind of our experience and gave us a 20%off card for next time if there is a next time. I wasn't looking for a discount but I was looking for another glass of wine and dessert but I ended up leaving because I was really upset about the lack of service. I give two stars because the food was good.

One of Vegas' best restaurants.  We were long-time fans of Chef Mark, and we were so pleased when he moved to our part of town to open this restaurant.  Everything they cook is creative and delicious, even the humblest fare, like burgers and pizza.  Truffled potato chips with blue cheese.  Roasted baby beets with toasted pistachios.  Hand-cut pappardelle with oxtail ragout.  Just thinking about it makes my mouth water.  The service is impeccable without being pretentious.  Casual meals, date nights, or business luncheons, this restaurant always delivers.

I'm suggesting that you basically ignore the negative reviews.  This is a solid restaurant that has never let me down.  Flawless?  No, but solidly reliable good service and food.  I think you'll agree.

With the opening of Downtown Summerlin, we were happy to see a Wolfgang Puck's on the list of restaurants.  My wife and I when Puck's first opened and enjoyed it enough that we've been back several times.  It definitely has a casual bar and grill feel, and they've set it up to make everyone comfortable regardless of dress.  We've seen jeans and t-shirts at one table, and business attire just a few tables away.  Even so, the fine dining quality found at other Wolfgang Puck's restaurants isn't lost here.  You're treated very well by the wait staff and the food is prepared and served in a manner that makes you think they're cooking just for you.

Recommendations:  if it's lunchtime, try one of the salads or the Italian Sausage or Roasted Vegetable pizza.  At dinner, come hungry and try any of the pastas to start followed by the Scottish Salmon or the Garlic and Herb Chicken.  Or if you're in a burger mood, the Mesquite Grilled Burger won't disappoint.  (I've had fish there twice now and both times it was perfectly cooked.)  Always be sure to ask about the daily specials too.

If you like Wolfgang Puck's, keep in mind they have a room for private dining as well.  You'll need to reserve it in advance.  They also cater.

With Downtown Summerlin being so accessible off the 215, drive over and enjoy a stroll through the shops.  When you're ready for a meal or just want to sit and enjoy a drink at the bar, consider Wolfgang Puck's.  I don't think you'll be disappointed.

Happy hour here has become one of my favorite happy hours in Las Vegas. It has some great food offerings as well as good deals on drinks. The patio is great for those non 100 degree days. Also, applause to the Golden Knights decor the restaurant has added!!

I was excited to try this place with my boyfriend for an early dinner. Upon entering the interior decor was rustic with an open kitchen. I seriously wanted to love this place so much. Everything was going so well, decor was gorgeous, appetizer was an amazing start, and attention to our drinks were on point. It was great until I received my pasta. The waiter set the dish in front of me and I'm thinking, wow this is going to be so good. My boyfriend stole the first bite of my pasta which is so typical of him. Anyways, he told me that the pasta was undercooked! I said no... This is Wolfgang's restaurant this can not happen. So I took a bite out of the pasta and you can definitely tell it was undercooked. It was basically raw in the middle. I know you probably think, "Oh no, it's called al dente." NO! It was freaking raw. So, I told my server that the pasta was underdone and she had the audacity to say oh no we definitely cook our pasta al dente. Homegirl! No that sh*t is not. She told me that they can definitely take it back and cook it a little bit more for me. Ughhh seriously don't treat me like I'm stupid and picky. I've eaten so much pasta in my lifetime to know what is al dente and rock hard. So my server takes the dish back and I see the cooks in the back looking smug and annoyed because they have to redo a dish. At this point I'm just over it. I tried liking this place but that little comment just annoyed so much that I can't even. Whatever. Food would have tasted a lot better if they cooked it right the first time. My boyfriend's burger wasn't even impressive either, just salty. At the end, we paid for an okay meal that had high hopes but fell short due to execution and service. Lesson learned kids, not all places with a celebrity chef's name on it is going to be great.

TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE PER THE MANAGER. 

Just left five minutes ago to eat at crave after a subpar experience. Ordered the burger and asked to add mushroom and spinach. Waiter came back and told me that it would be an extra 9 dollars to add the two so I declined considering the burger is only 12 dollars. Asked for a menu to change my order and nothing else seemed all that great. That's when I decided to leave. Asked the waiter if I needed to pay for the untouched water and Arnold Palmer I ordered and he had the manager come over to speak with me. The manager explained that the reason for the high price is because they use a wild mushroom. He kept saying he didn't want me to feel as though I was being cheated. I felt fine until the waiter brought over a ten dollar check for the water and Arnold Palmer. I asked the manager as he passed by why I was being charged and he laughed and said he'd handle it. Absolutely terrible customer service from the very manager. Never will I ever eat here nor shall I suggest anyone come here. Save you money and eat anywhere else.

Had never been and hubby and I decided to try. We were seated quickly and we didn't have a reservation on a Friday night. Service was wonderful. The young lady that waited on us was very attentive. I don't remember the spelling of her name but it may have been Raluca (possibly??). We ordered a berry monitor and a Moscow Mule, drinks were tasty. Also had the salmon entree with arugula and beans and hubby had the chicken Parmesan and pasta. Portion size was good. We also ordered a pepperoni pizza to go. My husband mentioned it was my birthday and they brought our a serving of carrot cake with a candle, it was so tasty. If I had know I wouldn't have ordered the chocolate lava cake. They were nice enough to pack the carrot cake to go and I got to share it at home the next day. An extra perk was the fact that we had a 20% yelp check-in discount. It all made for a wonderful birthday date. Looking forward to our next visit.

Service could not be worse...a waiter with an attitude? Good luck with that. Food is average...Management is obviously dropping the ball, not training or hiring appropriate staff.  Wolfgang. .. I'm telling Ramsey on you.

My husband and I had dinner at Wolfgang Puck's on Tuesday, November 1.  We enjoyed the Truffle Chips to start, along with a delicious Old Fashioned and Indian Sunset beverages.  The order of chips was huge- plenty to share, but we wanted to save room for our steaks.  

My hubby had the Flat Iron with French Fries, and I had the Grilled Ribeye.  Both were delicious!  The food came out hot, and stayed warm while we dined.  

The ambiance was nice- obviously you're in the middle of a casino, and the restaurant has no walls, so you can hear the noise- but it wasn't bad at all.  

Our server was AWESOME!  I'm disappointed we can't remember his name ... possibly Zak.  He gave us great menu ideas, brought out a delicious bottle of Cabernet (Justin), and was very attentive.  

All in all we had a wonderful time at Wolfgang Puck's, and we will return!

4th visit and I want to say I sort of regular by now. WP is the pnly restaurant in my opinion that is doing great food at downtown summerlin. Ive been to them all. 
Great feel to the restaurant, but not too busy. Pretty sad actually. 
If I had one request it would be to bring back the shishito peppers. Other than that, I look forward to my next visit.

UPDATE
Revisited the grill after picking up my new iPhone from the Apple store. Not much has changed.

 I'm beginning to think this is not truly a restaurant owned by the world famous chef Wolfgang Puck but rather some kind of low end franchise deal.

Simply stated, this place just does not live up to the high standards of quality service and food for which chef Puck is famous.

The location is great and the interior is nice. However, the food was extremely bland. I got a burger and fries with a side of Mac & cheese. The burger was dry and nearly tasteless. The fries were steak fries that seemed unseasoned. The Mac & cheese was terrible. The pasta used was super thick and the cheese, like the rest of the food, was flavorless. My husband got the Margherita pizza and Caesar salad. He also hated it. The Caesar salad was boring and the pizza was oily. Needless to say, we were extremely disappointed. There's nothing we hate more than paying for food that we didn't enjoy. There are plenty of restaurants in the area, we'll go somewhere else next time.
Getting better and better.  Great food, better prices than strip.   Quality ingredients.

Phenomenal service and great atmosphere. Came here the first time for girls night on a Friday. They have happy hour from 3-close! I was definitely sold. The cocktails were well made and the food tasted amazing. I definitely will be coming back.

Wow this place has gone downhill...been here a couple of dozen times over the last few years.  Haven't had a good meal here in over a year.  Just bad execution and poor quality control...little things like overdressed salad or poorly seasoned dishes...service is solid but I can't justify coming here for such mediocre food at that price point.  Rather go to CPK next door where the managers pay a visit to the table every time and the quality is more consistent at a slightly lower price point.

Went here yesterday with a party of 5 people.  It's a nice lunch spot to meet up with friends for the atmosphere.    I think if I went again: it would be for a cocktail and not if I was hungry.   All of my friends food looked great (presentation)  however;  no one was raving about their meals.    I had the caesar salad and asked for chicken.  It was super bland.  I actually was thinking maybe they forgot the dressing.   I added my friend's dill dressing on my salad hoping it would make it better.   Another friend had the chicken salad sandwich which was a lunch special and said it was pretty good.   Another had a steak salad which was also a lunch special.  Another had a burger and fries.  (The skinny fries were very good).   This place is still new but it was no comparison to a SPAGO (also a Wolfgang Puck restaurant).  Anyway, the bill was $104. We left a $20 tip so that's basically $24 a person for lunch.   Seems a little pricey to me for what you get/got.   I'd rather go to Red Robin and pay half the price and walk out "full" and satisfied.   Too bad they can't get those other restaurants open at Downtown Summerlin.  I mean, really, the mall opened Oct 9.

I am ALWAYS impressed with Wolfgang Puck's places, and I have been to several. This one is NO EXCEPTION!! 

From the moment we walked into the door, until the moment we left it was fantastic!
The service was impeccable, the food was fresh & delicious! My partner had home made past with Rabbit Ragu - YUM!! I had a rock shrimp pizza, which was a real pizza not a flatbread pizza ( Although I love FB Pizzas too) We started with the calamari.
It was a perfect lighter dinner before heading off to the movies on our date night!

What is perfect about this place is you, you could sit down with friends after a day of shopping at Downtown Summerlin and have a yummy selection of 'family style' snack foods for the table, or you could sit down for an amazing 3 course dining experience!

Here is my insider tip- During the colder months, if you make a reservation ask for inside. They did not seem to make a difference between indoor and out door dining with reservations, it is just where there is a an open table. We sat out side under a heater, which was fine for us. But was also watched another table of 4 leave because they could not accommodate their reservation inside even after they said they were cold and uncomfortable outside.

Really happy to have this new gem in the neighborhood!

Been here on a few occasions and must recommend to always get their chef specials! I had the fish tacos, that were delicious came in 4 which was more than enough. Usually order the tuna tartare, made perfectly with these crisp chips that melt in you mouth. The happy hour cheese& charcuterie board is excellent and offers the perfect amount if you looking for a light bite. They offer a "Sunday supper" which is a prefix and that you pay(25$?) per person. However I feel your group size needs to be just the right size so the serving portions are evenly distributed. Because you want to try everything,  you're already stuffed by the 3rd course. Recommend going with that if you're in a group with hungry indecisive people

To start off..I usually love all the Wolfgang Puck restaurants..and I definitely love him..but the restaurant in Summerlin was a disappointment.  The ice water..c'mon man..filter it atleast. Everyone at our table agreed that it was nasty.  The bruschetta was tasty.  The Mushroom Fettuccine..bland and dry.  The barbecue chicken pizza..bland..dry flavorless chicken and dry tasteless crust.  They possibly could have offered parmesean to add some flavor..but they didnt.  My friend liked the salmon.  Overall..big..expensive disappointment.

I think the key is to arrive early and beat the crowd. We had eaten at other Wolf Gang Pucks in the past with just ok food and service. We arrived around
 4:30 and sat off the bar area. Everyone from the hostess, bartender, and server were great. Food was excellent as were the drinks. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for the food, service, and ambiance.
