I was very disappointed in this restaurant.  If you are looking for a quiet restaurant-forget it with this place.  It was very loud and the service was slow.  The food was very average.  The waiter came by various tables and offered artisan bread, along with olive oil for dipping, as bread was not placed on the tables.  After taking one piece, the waiter asked us if we liked the bread and proceeded to state, if we did, then we could purchase it and pointed to the area where they were selling the bread.  For a restaurant of this size and the name-Wolfgang Puck, I would expect to have a small portion placed at each table.  There are far better places to dine in Las Vegas, and Wolfgang Puck Bar and Grill won't be one of them for me.
Good quality food. Excellent service. Good deals on happy hour. Half price wine M-Th. What's not to like?
Excelente comida excelente servicio ..Iloy excelente busser.cuarta visita y seguiremos volviendo buena ubicación

It upsets me to have to post this scathing review, but people need to know that the staff as well as the manager at this fine establishment are racist, and they employ discriminatory practices in order to keep minorities out...allow me to expound...my friends and I, (all black)decided to go to Wolfgang Puck in Summerlin after enjoying dinner elsewhere in the plaza. After being seated, we were quickly told by Lauren that no outside food was allowed. I let her know that we would not be eating the food (I and another member of our party had bagged, to-go orders with us from the restaurant we had previously dined at). Lauren said that it did not matter that we were not eating it because any outside food was against Wolfgang Puck's policies. She said, "so, I could throw it away" we, of course, decided to leave rather than allow her to throw our food away. We sat by an outside fire nearby the restaurant, and we continued our evening. To my dismay about 10 minutes later a white man and his friend entered the restaurant with bags of takeout...my friends and I watched in disbelief as the man took a seat by the bar, and began ordering drinks! At no time did anyone approach this man and his friend to let them know that outside food was not allowed. I decided to go speak with the restaurant manager about the unequal treatment my friends and I had received. Chelsea (the manager) and Lauren (the hostess) proceeded to pretend (unconvincingly) that they had not seen the man and his companion enter with bags of takeout. They then went on to lie and say that the man's food had been thrown away; the food was still sitting on the bar! When we let the two women know that the food was still on the bar, Chelsea and Lauren suddenly remembered that the restaurant offers patrons the option of placing outside food on the counter. This realization came as news to my friends and me because placing our food on a counter was not an option that was offered to us. Our options were to throw our food away or to leave. It is a shame that in 2016 there are establishments that continue to employ discriminatory policies in an effort to keep the patrons that they desire in and the patrons that they find less than desirable out! I should not have to say this, but my friends and I are all young, black professionals. We have more degrees among us than there were people in our group. I will never step foot inside of another Wolfgang Puck restaurant. Racism is alive and well in 2016! SHAME ON YOU WOLFGANG PUCK!

Best place in Vegas to watch the Golden Knights play!!!
Amazing food and even better service.
#GoKnightsGo
Place was alright. All items we got were awesome!  I really liked the gazpacho! My Wife really enjoyed the truffle oil/blue cheese chips.

Food five star, service 3 star hence the 4 stars. 
Everything we had, (enjoyed Restaurant Week Menu) including the brick chicken, pizza with mozz-and red sauce, tortilla soup, and a salted caramel sugar cookie dessert was so tasty and flavorful. 
Service did drop the ball. We were seated and were approached by a waiter who introduced himself and said he would be back shortly. 7 minutes later another server came over and without any explanation took over. She was wonderful throughout and was very helpful. The runners is where the service gaffs occurred. We did not get new silverware between courses and the worst gaff came when the runner delivered the desserts during the MIDDLE of our enjoying our main course. He didn't offer to clear, just dropped the dishes and again no silverware was replenished. The waitress saw it after the fact and apologized but didn't take the desserts back, just left them there. 
We Definitely felt rushed. The restaurant wasn't full.

This place was just Ok. When I saw Wolfgang Puck I was thinking that the food was going to be amazing. We started with the truffle mac and cheese it was pretty good. But the pizza had little to no flavor also the only burger on the menu had little to no flavor as well. The service was pretty good. I was just slightly disappointed in the food.

stopped in last night @ 7:30PM. Was seated on the patio. waited 40 mins. before the drinks arrived. they arrived only after our second complaint that we hadn't received anything. Place was NOT busy. Plenty of tables. 

Food was good. but, good food is available all over las vegas.

Best Short Ribs in Town! I'd Rather have lunch here than any other place in town !! Always Fresh & Dependable ! The staff are always eager to please ! I just had my birthday lunch here last month and it was fabulous !!!

Food was fine but the perfectly pleasant waitress forgot one of the main courses. Our friend declined her offer to quickly get it made and instead ordered just a side of fries. I was surprised to see that she charged us for them after her error, low rent behavior for this kind of place.

Love the food and wine selections here! I don't know any where else in Summerlin where you can get Margerum by the glass, I definitely recommend trying it if you're into to suav blancs from California! Besides that, the caesar salad is delicious and the big eyed tuna tartar. And of course what's not to love about the cheese and charcuterie plate!? I always get helped by a woman behind the bar, wish I remembered her name, but she is amazing. Always amazing food and service!

The food was good. I ordered the halibut and the cauliflower and it was very tasty. The service was SLOW. We waited a long time to order and for the server to take our plates and bring the bill.  Not sure why because the restaurant was basically empty.

Food: Hit or miss
Beer Selection: Pleasantly surprising 
Brand: Starting to become questionable 
Service: Much to be desired

Spaghetti & meatballs had a half delicious side and a half scorching, spicy, and dry.

Braised short ribs tasted decent but was just so ugly to look at. 

Appetizers were on par with basic bar food.

Best part was the Trappist beer.. 

Slow, disorganized, borderline pompous, and lost most points because they brought my kids juice 3/4 of the meal through accompanied by a series of excuses. Oh and where was the two order of bread we ordered? I'm sure there was an excuse for that too but I can't recall. I think my last good WGP experience was at the LAX airport. Will keep to our usual spots at DT Summerlin.

Great service thanks to Victor! Superb and tasty food!(thumbs up to the chef and staff in the kitchen) But most of all this restaurant is kid friendly! We're almost at the end of our meal when Agustin went to our table and asked us if my daughter is interested in making her own pizza since the place is not very busy, of course my daughter said yes and she loved every second of it! It was an awesome and fun experience! Now she wants to be a pizza maker when she grows up! Kudos to Agustin, Victor, Chef and all the staff of this amazing restaurant!

In celebration of the first day of spring we dined on the patio with a view of the beautiful foliage around the arroyo.  The patio wraps around the building and allows the choice of shade or sun plus the addition of many umbrellas and  heaters.
Service was prompt and friendly. There is a nice selection wines at a reasonable price point.
The starter plate chosen was grilled spanish octopus with greens, fingerling potatos and romesco sauce. The octopus was nice and tender but not over cooked. The romesco sauce worked well with the greens and potatos. The size of this dish was just right.
For the main event we choose the DTS chopped salad which large enough to be an entree. The salad had a variety of vegetables and varies by market availbility. On this day  it had several lettuces, tomatoes and olives plus quinoa and croutons all incorporated in a champagne vinaigrette. As an option chicken, salmon or shrimp can be added to the salad.
Desert was a wonderful pineapple upside down cake with buttermilk pineapple sherbet. 
The reastaurant is another great addition to growing number of dining choices in Downtown Summerlin.

Took my husband here for his birthday dinner. He has a severe gluten sensitivity and the staff really catered to his needs. It can be a little awkward and I'm sure kitchens hate it, but they were patient and understanding. Our waiter talked with us for a long time about his recommendations and even talked with my husband extensively about the whiskey options. My husband is a whiskey lover so it meant a lot. The waiter even bought our drinks. Exceptional food, great cocktails, lovely restaurant. Would revisit in a heartbeat.

Mixed review at dinner tonight.  I saw that they offered a Sunday Supper for $25 per person. I asked what the supper menu looked like and it sounded like something the family would like.  It's a great bargain with delicious food.  However portions don't work for  family.  I'd rather pay more and be satisfied.  Their Sunday supper is for a minimum of family of 4.  We have five in our family...which they charged for 5 but gave us  portions for 4.  

Apps:  Calamari, margharita pizza, and tomato & burrata salad.  All very tasty.  One small pizza for the table is basically one small slice per person.  Calamari was delicious, but again not enough for five people. 

Entree:  Rotisserie chicken, rigatoni pasta, and flat iron steak.  The steak was pre-sliced and ended up serving 1 small slice per person.  The small pasta dish was empty within minutes.  The chicken portion was healthy.

Sides:  Broccollini and Roasted Potatoes.  Good portions and tasty.

Dessert:  Red velvet cake and cherry cobbler.  Two regular dessert portions for five people.  My wife and I didn't even get a taste of the cake as we split it up for our kids.

Everything we had was delicious.  Portions were pretty ridiculously small.  

Our server was very sweet and we mentioned it to her.  She talked to the kitchen and brought out another serving of the pasta.  We also ordered another pizza for the table.  

It's a great value with good food.  Portions are way too small.  Mind you...we had two adults and three kids (14, 11, 6).   Five adults would be famished after this meal.   

I would rather pay $35 per person and have an adequate amount of food.

To add insult to injury, our server told me that my credit card was declined.  When I called Wells Fargo, they said that the restaurant tried to charge the card incorrectly so it triggered a fraud alert.

Very disappointed with dinner...despite the excellent flavors.

Me and the family were looking a place to sit outside and this was the place to pick!! We waited no longer than 15 minutes.  My stepmom and I had asked about the complimentary mimosas and even though I didn't get a brunch item he still gave me the mimosa!  Great service. As for the food, AMAZING! I got the mesquite grilled burger cooked medium. Best burger I've had in awhile! Can't wait to try this place out again.
Nothing to write home about. Ignorant staff, manager doesn't care and it showed in the service. Overpriced. Will not return.

You have got to be joking with the service. The waiter had zero clue as to what food went where. Nothing was organized. Nothing came out at the same time. Seriously sad if this is their quality of service and food.

I was just wondering if it is a good thing that the head chef or sous chef is standing where the orders are coming out and he's actually standing there eating something off a plate while everyone in the restaurant can see him?  Shouldn't he be eating a meal away from the food line?

My Mom and I are big fans! We always start with the truffle chips-they're to die for. The free range chicken wings are good as well; a little spicy, but not too much. I like the seafood linguine, though it can be on the salty side. I also recently had the ravioli, which I do not see listed on their site, but it was excellent. We have always had excellent service here and I have zero complaints. I'll have to venture out and try some different menu items in the future.

Brunch is very solid here. Bottomless mimosas last until 3pm and the menu includes classic brunch items like eggs and benedicts as well as burgers and pizzas. We came on a typical Sunday and sat outside. Staff was awesome and food was very good. At our table we roared a Benedict, avocado toast, regular burger, and turkey burger. Burgers were ready and wee full  meals. Avocado toast came with just one piece of toast.  It was very good but could be made at home for sure; nothing spectacular. The Benedict was just the eggs and muffins, no potatoes as a side even, which was disappointing. Very tasty but small. The dish was great but a side is a necessity. 

All in all, the mimosa service was the best I've ever had. The glass was always full and the waiter didn't judge.  Unfortunately it was only orange juice in the mimosa, but I still enjoyed it. Wolfgangs is very solid and worth a go if you're looking for a relaxing way to do a Sunday.

Went in to check it out for dinner on Thursday. Ordered the striped bass that came with a side of garlic spinach. And a side order of Mac Mac cheese. Sea bass was light and airy. Lacked flavor but was ok. Had a nice buttery touch though. The garlic spinach was cooked just right with a balance of garlic spice in every bite. The mac n cheese was actually shells n cheese. White processed cheese was ok bit again....not great. Might give them a other shot but a 70$ bill with one entree and a side....NO thank you. to be continued. .......................

We had a wonderful dinner here the other night. 
The service is very efficient and friendly and the food is amazing. 
We ordered some appetizers and they were delicious, but the star of the evening was the fish, I ordered the Idaho Trout and my wife the Sea Bass, they were phenomenal, very well prepared and so delicious that I could have ordered another one for myself. The sauce was super tasty and added more flavor to the fish. 
And we also loved the sides, broccolini, caramelized corn and the Fava beans was really good. 
My wife loves the cheesecake here. 
We can't wait to go back. 
This is the best restaurant off the strip in Las Vegas. 
And we really like that it is a celebrity chef restaurant that we can afford to go to. 
Wonderful experience!

I went here for the first time with my wife, 3 kids under 11 and my dad. We each had food that we absolutely loved. My dad is a spaghetti and meatballs snob and he absolutely loved his. My wife's fish and chips were some of the best I've had and my bbq chicken pizza was also great. My kids ordered pizza, chicken fingers and a cheeseburger from the kids menu and they were each thrilled with their food. They did bring out the wrong order for my wife at first, but rectified the problem quickly. All in all it was a great place to take the family and we'll definitely go back.
Went for the first time for a lunch meeting. We sat at the bar and had great service and awesome appetizers! Will be back!

Wow there's really not much to say about this place other than it's overpriced and not great.

The servers and the venue are great but the food was not enjoyable. We had a salad with vinaigrette. That was okay. Didn't have much flavor to it. Then had the fish and chips. The fish was not good. It fell apart so quickly. It was soggy and there was no crisp at all to the batter/breading. 

Save your money and go elsewhere for better fish and chips.

I was a little disappointed about the food it wasn't as good as i would hope. I'm not sure if it just don't have the flavor i was hoping for. The service was great and the place is nice but food wasn't to my expectations of wolfgangs puck establishment.

We don't need another food joint like this one, employees stuck up and most of cooks are hang out at the dining area and cursing at customers.

Night and day, compare to one in Crystal on strip.

We need some place we can be happy not struggle with their employees. We are not there to work with their employees.

Just a couple of drinks on the patio on a Friday afternoon. The have non alcoholic beer which is all I drink. Patio is in a good spot with good people watching. Service was very friendly and not over priced at $6 per drink.
Beautiful atmosphere! I ordered the toasted vegetable pizza. The servers are super nice and friendly. Id say come dressed nicely. I came in a sweater and felt a little out of place

Traveling through Las Vegas, we made a planned stop in Summerlin to try out the new Wolfgang Puck bar and Grill and we were so glad that we did!!  From the decor to the service to the quality and taste of the food, everything far surpassed any expectations.

We started out with the grilled octopus, the tuna tartar and the beet salad.  The tuna tartar was exceptional.  I usually don't like beets but this salad may have changed my mind.  It was amazing!  I had a whiskey sour as a little treat and it was delicious - definitely not just something thrown together with sour mix (which I hate).

My friends ordered the Chinese Chicken salad and the burger - both of which they said were thoroughly satisfying and tasty.  I ordered the rigatoni with turkey sausage bolognese which may have changed my life.  It was easily one of the most delicious things I have ever eaten.  I wanted to take a picture of it but I realized that I ate almost all of it by the time the thought even occurred to me.  Both of my friends were in complete agreement after trying a few (as many as they could steal) bites of my dish.

We decided to splurge and ordered a few desserts - chocolate lava cake, pineapple upside down cake, and creme brûlée.  We definitely went overboard but we were celebrating so we decided to just go for it.  Everything was amazing, not that we were surprised.  I don't even think we could pick a favorite, it was all so good.  They pair the pineapple upside down cake with pineapple sorbet which was such a delicious combo.

All in all, the meal was amazing.  We will definitely come back and may even plan another trip through vegas just so we can stop off here and eat until we are stuffed again.

Had lunch on the patio, the atmosphere was great. Our server was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu and drinks. The food was fantastic, very flavorful. Portions are average but not too little, just the right size. The main dining room is large with a fine dining aspect but still relaxed. Will definitely be back for dinner!

The menu may not be groundbreaking, but the execution has been excellent almost every visit. Add to that a dark, comfortable dining area with views into an open kitchen and you've got a spot that has gained much popularity since opening in the new Downtown Summerlin shopping district.

Like other Wolfgang spots around town, you'll find pizzas. The Asian BBQ chicken pizza ($14) lacked enough hoisin to give it a distinct Asian flavor, but the chicken, broccoli, chiles and cilantro still made it a satisfying dish. I preferred the potato leek pizza ($12) with its sweet garlic, goat cheese and guanciale toppings. The chewy crust on both showed an ample amount of char and blisters and delivered some great flavors.

There are a handful of pasta dishes on the menu. The hand-crafted rags of pasta that make up the garganelli ($15) were impressive. The turkey bolognese sauce added much savoriness while the basil whipped ricotta added a touch of sweetness.

Among entrees simplicity seems to be the concept behind every dish. The sea bass ($34) looks like a minimally plated dish but is expertly seasoned and roasted, sitting atop a gremolata and garlic spinach. Equally bare is a tender, lean grilled New York strip ($37) topped with an herb butter coating its well charred exterior and accompanied by a handful of skinny fries. Their mesquite grilled burger ($12) won't win any awards for originality, but it's a well crafted combination of aged cheddar, red onion marmalade, and bacon aioli atop a patty larger than the bun it's in.

For dessert the bread pudding ($9) and molten chocolate cake ($9) are tried and true dishes that will satisfy your need for a sugar fix. Their best option is a flaky and buttery apple crostada ($8) with caramel and vanilla gelato.

The familiar fare may not push culinary boundaries, but it should play well to the Summerlin crowd. There are plenty of dishes that are approachable yet elevated when compared to similar spots on this side of town. The "something for everyone" approach is great for local families and folks who don't consider themselves "foodies" yet still has enough well crafted plates to satisfy more sophisticated palates.

I met a friend here for lunch and we were both really pleased with our food and our server was great about checking on us. I've had this place on my bookmark list since it opened and am glad I finally checked this place out, but regret not coming sooner because the pizza I had was perfection. I came here with an open mind and had no expectations other than the what I'd usually expect from a WP restaurant which is exactly what I experienced. I personally find the menu to be spot on given it's a bar and grill and this place fits perfectly in Downtown Summerlin. 

We started out with cocktails, I had the Classic Margarita, and we finished our meal with coffee and both tasted great.

Truffle Potato Chips ($9) - House-made potato chips infused with truffle oil and covered with Maytag blue cheese sauce and chunks of cheese. Get this! The chips taste great alone, but the cheese sauce just takes the chips to another level. My friend and I had no shame when it came to scraping up every last bit of cheese sauce we could from the bottom of the bowl. Very good!

Margherita Pizza ($15) - The sauce tasted so fresh and the crust had the perfect crispness. I loved every bite of this pizza and will absolutely order it again. Not surprising at a WP restaurant that the pizza was amazing. The price was fair given the quality ingredients and they do have gluten free crusts on small pizzas if that's your thing.

The HH menu is worth checking out and they also offer patio dining. I'll be back.

The food was great, the service was suspect at first, but then really picked up for the second half of the meal and the decor is superb! 

So the food: everything we had was very good! The truffle potato chips are a delicious app! I know! I typically don't order chips for an app, but the waitress recommended them...so we obliged. She was spot on with the recommendation! They were hot and crispy with a delicious truffle/cheese sauce on top! We all sat around and talked while picking at them! Our second app was the Tuna Tartare and it was equally as delicious! Obviously they are at completely opposite ends of the spectrum, but it was very good in its own right! 

The service was a little snooty at first, but she really warmed up after we ordered our apps. By the end of our meal I really enjoyed her service! 

The decor is industrial/shabby chic and I loved everything about it! The green glasses were amazing! Lol I know it doesn't really matter, but I enjoyed it! 

Overall it was a very good place and I will most certainly be back!

Came here around 2:30 for late lunch. 
I got a free truffle potato chips for checking in!! It was very good.
Wolfgang's chopped salad was way smaller than I thought. I think $13 was overpriced.
The salmon was OK. 
The service was nice and quick. Our waiter was very friendly. 
Will be back if I'm in the neighborhood and want a quick bite!!

Really disappointed that my Chinese chicken salad for $22 was the serving size of a side salad you order with an entree...

I used an outside delivery service to order for myself and coworker and when our food arrived we both had small cartons of a simple salad with cashews and wonton crisps along with a container of one chicken breast in it. We both paid the additional $9 each for chicken to accompany our salads and we both ate feeling under satisfied after having to split the one piece we received. 

I realize there are a few extra dollars that accompany a world renowned Chef's restaurant, but I am baffled I that I just paid that much money for what seemed to be simple side salad. On the other hand the chicken was cooked perfectly and was full of flavor.

Great place for appetizers.  Food is at the level you would expect for the name. Service was fine.  Nothing especially jumped out.  We were seated in a weird location in the restaurant, but it's a nice ambiance over all.  I think this is an adequate choice for a business meeting, or a break from shopping if you want a fine dining experience.  Conveniently located in the "restaurant row" section of downtown Summerlin mall.

My husband and I ordered from the Restaurant Week menu and we were very happy with our choices.  He ordered the Baja Shrimp ceviche, kind of like a shrimp Bloody Mary, the BeefShort Ribs, and the Peach Crumble cheesecake. Great shrimp, light, tasty; the ribs were a very good portion and very tender; and the dessert was delicious.  One note - not enough peaches on the cheesecake!  

I ordered the Apple Endive Salad which was just a lovely mix of flavors and very light; the Grilled Trout - so fresh and seasoned well; and the Pretzel Caramel Tart which was like a chocolate/caramel candy bar with vanilla ice cream - large portion so I would recommend sharing this one.

Good service, great food and a nice atmosphere.  Only complaint was there was music playing and that typically amps up the noise level along with the place being very full on a Friday night.

I'd prefer to leave a 3.5 star because I'm basing my review as someone who prefers not to eat meat with every meal. Their options for meatless meals are very limited and the ones they do have are fried. They happy hour per their sign is from 3pm to close which is great and their menu for is ok. They have two house wines (Cabernet  and Chardonnay) which were decent. The food option for happy hour were a disappointment so we chose to only have drinks and move on to the next place. The environment is really clean and modern however it's quite warm inside. Everyone once in a while someone would walk by and cause a breeze thankfully.

Had a girl's night here last night, and this place was perfect for drinks and small dishes. I heard they have great house wines here, and I can attest to that! I really enjoyed my Rose (not too sweet but light and fruity) and also their Moscow Mule. 

We ordered the Heirloom Caprese, Crispy Calamari, Artisanal Charcuterie Platter, Salmon Tartare Potato Chips, and Spiced Cauliflower. Among these, I enjoyed the Heirloom Caprese since it was fresh and tangy, and the mozzarella on the Caprese was perfectly melted over fresh tomatoes. The Artisanal Charcuterie Platter was packed with flavor, and the cured cuts of meat were really tasty with the cheese varieties and toasted bread. I also think this was a good choice since it pairs well with wine. The Spiced Cauliflower was a popular favorite among my group, but I personally felt it to be a bit bland. 

I didn't enjoy the Salmon Tartare Potato Chips and the Crispy Calamari too much. The salmon was lacking tanginess or flavor or something, it just was forgettable. With the crispy calamari, it wasn't as crispy as I would have liked and some pieces felt a bit soggy and it also was lacking in the flavor component. 

For the main courses, we ordered the Rigatoni, which for me was nothing special. However, I loved their Sausage Pizza! The crust was perfect and so was the ratio of cheese to sausage. The bread here in general is yum, including the free bread. 

I would have given this place a 5 since the service was phenomenal and the experience was great, but just a few dishes for me fell short. I would definitely come back for the Pizza and the Wine!

I thoroughly enjoyed our dinner experience here last night, and it was boosted by the impeccable service we received upon entering all the way through exiting.

We arrived about 20 minutes before our reservation time, and when I said we were early, the hostesses and someone that I think was maybe the manager waved it off like it was no big deal and sat us immediately.  As we walked to our table, we were greeted by waiters and servers as we walked by.  Very friendly.  The first table we sat at was right by the back door to the patio, so my husband asked if we could move away from the door, and she said of course and promptly moved us to a booth without any hesitation.

Our waiter (I think his name was Eric) came right over and was very attentive throughout the meal.  We ordered the cheese and salume board for an app.  It was a nice portion and the truffled honey was delicious.  Word of caution, the horseradish mustard will clear your nostrils out!  So spicy!  For dinner, I had the papperdelle with oxtail ragu.  The noodles were the definition of al dente and perfect.  The ragu had a slightly sweet flavor that made me keep coming back for more as I tried to figure out what it was.  My husband got the roast chicken, which was flavorful and so moist.  He also ordered the sweet potato as a side, but the maple butter on it made it a little too sweet for me.

It's also worth noting that their wines and cocktails are nicely priced.  I had a crisp New Zealand Sauv Blanc for just $8.  Most of the cocktails were around $11.

I see in some other reviews that people mention it is noisy in there, and that is true; it was quite loud in there.  But a restaurant can really be made on its service, and everyone here was friendly, accommodating, and welcoming without being overbearing.  We had a fabulous date night!

I have been to many of his restaurants and usually I am impressed. This was my first time at the DT Summerlin location. Met some friends for the 8PM happy hour. I like 8PM happy hours.

Cox was holding a very loud gathering at the bar. Felt more like a sports bar then anything that would have Wolfgang's name on it.

The happy hour pricing on the apps was good however the plate of calamari was tiny. Compare this to the size of the calamari app at Sienna. Night and day.

Our food was so good and served so fast. The macaroni and cheese is to die for! So is the margherita Pizza! We also got the jidori chicken but I thought it needed cheese. My boyfriend likes it though. All in all a great experience. I also like the moscato.

My fiancé and I went about a month after this place opened with high hopes since we love the location at MGM. We were quickly disappointed. Here's a list of the pros and cons in short because I don't even want to write a full review with detail because it might be just as painful as our experience there was. 

Pros
-Waitress was nice
-Decent Salads 

Cons
-Terrible seating (we were literally seated at the entrance and inches away from the table next to us) 
-Steak was awful
-Sea Bass was unimpressive 
-I wouldn't of even paid half of the amount of money we spent for the quality of food we received. 

Just a let down all together.

The food here is certainly tasty. And the service is AMAZING. For our appetizers we got the buffalo cauliflower and the tater tots, which was kind of a bad idea on our part since they both have buffalo sauce in them. Those tater tots were perfect. If you think you have had good tater tots, you haven't tried these. You have to try them. I got the wienerschnitzel, which I learned from the server is what Wolfgang orders whenever he comes. The food was perfect. Then dessert came. I don't know how so many things went wrong and everything came out right. I think it is the service. If it weren't for our waiter, everything would be ruined. We ordered the bread pudding and the skillet cake. Our server came over later and told us they were out of bread pudding. We got the crème brûlée instead. We waited for a strangely long time, and then the dessert sort of came out. The crème brûlée came out fine, but instead of the skillet cake, we got a brownie looking thing with chocolate sauce. We asked him about how this isn't a skillet cake, and he told us they didn't make that anymore, and they use a brownie instead of the cake. But, he informed us, they forgot to put ice cream on top of the brownie. So, he took it back to get ice cream. We ate the crème brûlée, and it was delicious, actually my favorite dessert. A little while later, a plate of tiramisu came out. The server told us it was on the house. Of course we were happy, who doesn't want free dessert? Then the brownie WITH ICE CREAM came out. It was good, but it was really nothing that special. But GEEZ the server was nice. By the end, we got free tiramisu, paid only three dollars for the brownie, and got twenty percent off the meal for their mistakes. I mean, what's wrong with that. The excellent service here really saved this experience.

Finally gave this place a visit for happy hour. The vibe and ambience of this place is great, I really liked the look of the place and it was comfortable.

Sat at the bar about 5 minutes before HH ended and the bartender was able to get my order in quickly. I got an order of the salt&pepper wings, parmesan fries and calamari. The food was pretty tasty, out of all my favorite were the wings. Definitely try those they are full of flavor. The only down side is that you only get 4!! The fries were a good portion and the calamari was good as well.

Can't forget the liquor - I tried the Summerlin Sour and this cocktail is probably what's gonna keep bringing me back. So refreshing, tasteful and the texture with the egg whites was perfect. Ended up having 3 with my girlfriend. Must try!

4/5 stars because I wasn't amazed with the happy hour food choices, but next time I will have to try the main menu.

We went for a happy hour and everything was delicious!!! We started with the chicken nachos and sangria. (Can't beat $5 sangria) for dinner I had the baked rigatoni. Full of flavor super delicious. Carla the bartender was so sweet and efficient. We will be back!
Just BLAH. Food is overpriced and small portions. Bland and mediocre. I expected much more for a Wolfgang Puck restaurant. Won't be back.

Horrific place and some of the worst food I've had.  Visited for a second time just to give this place a second chance.  Our second visit was unpleasant, starting with, most of the kitchen staff feeding themselves with food.  No, not tasting or sampling plates.  I'm talking about stuffing full shrimps and dipping nacho chips on a what seemed like a melted cheese pot.  The place was very slow with may 15 guests.  I pulled aside someone who seemed like the manager, but he immediately said he was the kitchen supervisor because someone who I can't remember the name left him in charge.  I explained what i saw left our plates with the disgusting meat loaf and WP burger untouched paid our bill of $82 and left immediately.  Will never visit this place and please seek other options.  If only WGP knew...
Very slow service. had three people  bring the food, but it the follow up or service after that. No drink refills, waited 10.minute between boxing leftovers a d getting the check.

Half of the happy hour menu here is a joke. Some of the offerings included $9 fried calamari. Which at most places would be great, except that it was for literally 9 pieces of small calamari. $1 per small piece of fried calamari is insane. I don't think I've seen that at any other place before. On top of that the $8 chicken wings for the happy hour menu was for 4 pieces of chicken. That's $2 per piece of chicken. Just take a look at the attached pictures. I still can't believe the food portions we received. 

Some of the slightly more reasonable offerings include the truffle potato chips at $5, the chicken nachos, and the fries. I absolutely hate that one can slap on a celebrity chef name onto bar food and call it fancy and think it's okay to charge absurd prices for small portions of food even for happy hour. NOT ON MY WATCH!

Our waitress was great.  Super recommendations, lots of energy and very attentive.  The food is consistently good and the atmosphere welcoming.  We had the Chinese Chicken Salad, the Caesar Salad, and the brunch eggwhite omelet. Oh, and the chocolate chip cookies - warm.  Everyone was happy.  We'll be back.

Ordered for weeknight evening dinner:
-calamari (would be great to have another dip option)
-bacon wrapped meatloaf special (good flavor, grilled meatloaf slices)
-burger & fries (ordered extra crispy fries, still soggy)
Total w/ Tip $60+

*other - bathroom was nice, but toilet paper had silver covers that you have to lift, both were empty...such a fail when I have to resort to seat covers to wipe up.

Quantity and Quality do not justify the prices of these items here. Service was great however, but having to pay the price we paid for a dinner for 2 that we can get at better prices and quality at CF, you can definitely find better elsewhere. Glad to have crossed off the list...

It's like I wasn't there.
5/18/18 at or about 1230. Went in, sat at the bar with only two other customers there. Manager, WFA with long black hair and a middle aged WMA bartender were doing something on the POS. After a few the manager left, the bartender spoke to the two at the bar and then left himself. 

Not once did the manager or bartender acknowledge that I was sitting there for 10 minutes. No "I'll be with you shortly" or anything. So I got up and left. I even asked the hostess if she saw me on the way out. 

I think the Puck Group needs to put those two through customer service training again. It takes but a moment to make contact with a guest.

Chef Rudow invited us to try out Wolfgang during the Farmers Market at Downtown Summerlin. 
Had dinner on Wednesday night. The kids had spaghetti and meatballs while I had Chicken Parm. For all those who like fresh made sauces. These guys and gals got it right. 
BTW. The fresh bread is for sale. The multi-grain and baguettes are amazing.

The food and happy hour here are good. If it was based only off that I would give them 5 stars. The service here could use some work.

The blue cheese chips were awesome as well as their $5 mai tais for happy hour. The pizzas were good as well. 

We had 4-5 waiters in the short time we were there.   We had to ask for everything water, napkins, to order food, happy hour options and even the bill.

Overall, I don't think I would recommend coming here.

We went for dinner on a Sunday night. The appetizer came out before our drink order. We had to flag down a bus boy to ask where our drinks were.  This was the theme for the night, order drinks and wait 20 minutes. I ordered the burger because $38 is ridiculous for a hanger steak. The burger was cooked properly and a good size.  The problem was it was so salty that I couldn't finish the burger. It was my first experience with Wolfgang Puck and was probably my last. It left me with a sore stomach and wondering why it's popular.

Had a relaxing lunch for 4 on a weekend.   

Why it's great?

1. outdoor seating with misters!
2. good music inside and outside (from the shopping complex)
3. reasonably priced (2 of us had the LV restaurant week special)
4. great portion sizes
5. they provided a set of freshly baked cookies for the bday boy (plus a candle)

Go early and browse the shopping complex, which is very nice.

*** Review is for Restaurant Week 2018 menu ***

Even though Wolfgang Puck's Bar and Grill has been in the neighborhood for almost three years, this was my first time eating here.  I looked at the RW menu and decided this would be a good way to test the food and service.

This was a $40 RW menu.  For the three courses, I chose the Baja shrimp ceviche with tostada crisps.  The ceviche had red pepper in it and on the rim of the glass.  There were pieces of avocado on the top of the ceviche.  After eating most of the ceviche, I lifted the glass and drank the remaining juices and got some good pepper taste.

The main I chose was the black pepper pappardelle with wild boar ragu and pecorino cheese.  The runner asked if I wanted pepper or parmesan and I asked for parmesan.  He came back with a small contained with freshly shredded cheese that I added to the pappardelle.

For dessert, I ordered the salted caramel pretzel tart.  

The main course was the star of the dinner.  The ceviche was good but the glass was so packed it made it a bit difficult to eat.  I know I have some tomato to make sure is removed from my shirt when I do laundry.  The pretzel tart was OK but I expected more pretzel.  There were bits of pretzel sprinkled on top of the caramel tart and alongside the piece but that was it. 

Service was excellent.
A real nice Lunch. Excellent Service! Food portion  was a little small, but very good.

Popped in here for a pre dinner cocktail there happy hour drinks and small treats sounded so delicious. Decided to sit at the bar and the bartender and other wait staff are a hopping fulfilling orders for waiting patrons. The bartender took my order and brought me a menu over. She was very pleasant and friendly. I have never visited a bar where the bartender comes to the tables in the bar area and floats around. I am so glad she is able to do this since it makes her job easier, fun, and more involved in the customer experience. 

The heartbeat of the bar is the bartender and the individual that is running this place is highly organized and very focused. She recommended the buffalo cauliflower which was fantastically hot but the burn goes away after a bit. I had a glass of rose to start but then with buffalo anything beer is the answer. To pair with the rest of the buffalo cauliflower decided on the beer flavored Sierra Nevada Hazy Little Thing. 

The ambiance of the restaurant/bar was so relaxing but still upscale enough to keep up the elegance of fine dining. The wood paneling is a great touch and so is the outside patio area which has a mist system. This being the desert with a great way to stay cool and proper shading the outside patio area is welcoming too, but I prefer good old air conditioning and cocktails indoors.

Didn't get a chance to experience what appears to be a nice menu! Went at noon yesterday (Tues) and upon entering, experienced the most restaurant noise ever! We were seated, but left before ordering, as it was just too much!

PS: Google shows the location about two miles south of where it actually is: within Downtown Summerlin shopping mall. (Google shows Oval Park Drive, but when 10955 is added, it relocates it to Garden Park Drive!)

I just sat down and ordered a water and a shot of bullit bourbon.  I took a sip of the water and was disgusted to find a fly now in my teeth.  Terrible.  I told the bartender and she apologized but made a thousand excuses as to why that never happens here.  She said she was going to talk to her manager, came back and didn't offer anything.  I completely lost my appetite so I did the shot and left after paying full price for it.  I'm basically shocked by the treatment and the fly you just don't except that from these kind of places.  I will never come back here and never recommend this place to a friend.

Wanted to try their happy hour!! 
Not bad !! 
Servers were very nice and very helpful. Food came out fast!! Loved loved the burger buns!! 
I could have had the buns just by themselves!!
Salads were good as well. Really satisfied!!

I have been here multiple times for brunch and dinner and have always had a great experience. The food is exactly what you would expect from a Wolfgang Puck establishment - fresh, delicious and beautifully presented. The service I've received has always been warm and pleasant and I will definitely be back! We had brunch last week on the patio and it was lovely,I had the breakfast burrito and my boyfriend had the huevos rancheros. Both were very good. We have also had the burger here before and it's delicious. Great neighborhood place for healthy and delicious food.

Delicious meal, exquisitely prepared with star service!

Being in the mood for something special, but one where I didn't have to get changed into something fancy, I chose to dine at Wolfgang Puck tonight. I have been going for a few nights for dinners and lunches, but I have never tried their tasting menu.

Dining on my own, I thought it would be perfect since I wanted to try new dishes, but didn't have to deal with a massive amount of food on my own. Generally, the tasting menu is for 2 or more people, but the staff   took pity on a solo diner. 

It's not because they let me try it that I'm gushing, but it's been a while in Summerlin where I feel I've had a perfect meal. I have my favorites in town, but, let's just say that it's been a while since I've so thoroughly enjoyed my meal like tonight.

To start, the staff was friendly, inviting, and accommodating. The service was well paced, and not intrusive. I portion sizes for the tasting meal was perfect for me, and you get five dishes, so it filled me up. Some may think it small, but I think it's exactly the amount of food - actually they give you more than what one should eat healthily for a dinner. 

The tasting menu consisted of 5 dishes.
1) an appetizer of salmon tartar - two oval mounds with creme fraiche and two large pieces of potato chip. The salmon was seasoned with a bit of crunch from cucumbers. It was mild in flavor, but the potato chips made a difference. It was clean tasting and and just enough to get my appetite going. Really good!

2) I've been eating a lot of their WP Chopped, and never tasted the Apple Endive. It's my new favorite. It has endive, macaron almonds, fennel, apples, and I forget what else. It comes with dots of balsamic, and it's crunchy, vinegary, sweet, and savory. Loved it! 

3) Pappardelle with boar was fabulous. I'm going to run out of superlatives to describe my meal. The pasta was thinner than most pappardelle, so that you can almost see your fork on the other side. The sauce was just sticky enough to coat each of the strands, and it was perfectly seasoned. I usually ask for chili flakes on my pasta, but I didn't even ask for it this time, because it was really flavorful. After this dish, I was getting full, and wondered how many dishes were in a tasting menu here. I finished everything. I'm on a low carb diet as well, but I ate the whole thing. It was just enough for me not to feel guilty. If I weren't on low carb, I'd definitely order this many times.

4) The market fish. I forgot what fish it was, but it was flaky and cooked well. I loved the foam. I think the server said it was some mushroom flavor... I don't know. But it was slightly salty, and ethereal - yeah, it's foam so it doesn't linger. The skin on the fish was crispy. I peeled it off and ate the whole thing first. So yummy. then, I squeezed the charred lemon on the rest of the fish and spinach. This dish is flavorful, but also super health. I'm on weight watchers, and on the program, I can probably eat this all night long. Excellent!

5) Finally, the dessert was cheesecake. Not just any cheesecake, but one that is creamy, moist, with texture that was substantial but also melted with a great mouthfeel. It came with fresh berries, whipped cream, and coulis. It was just the right amount of sweetness. I had to really work on my will power not to finish it, but it hit the spot. 

This was the perfect meal I was craving all day, and they delivered. THANKS for a great meal. AND, for $50, I think I'd go back again. Maybe it's not an every day meal for every one, but it sure felt like a value to me for all that I tried. The portions for me were great, and I'm not overstuffed and feeling uncomfortable after the meal. It was healthy, and super tasty. 

Wolfgang Puck has really kicked it up a few notches.

The food is good but the service is terrible!  The rating is more about the service, or lack of, than the food.  I expect a lot more than the server to come take your order and bring you your food and check with no attention in between.  The dos took forever to come out and nobody came by to even check-in or apologize for the delay.  Just unacceptable period.

Perfect restaurant with a wonderful patio ;)
The food is original and good ;)

Je suis français et ce restaurant propose des plats que nous pourrions avoir en France ;) Marre des burgers et de la junk food ? Venez déjeuner ou dîner ici ;)

Ps : Les plats sont d'inspiration Italienne ;)

The WP burger was very tasteful and the food was at a great warm temperature when it came to the table.  The place is very nice and elegant. Has a bar that you can sit and eat as well. You can also see the kitchen which I liked because you can see them preparing the food. Overall a good place and I can see myself returning. The staff were pleasant and welcoming as well.

Came here fore a work lunch on a Tuesday.  It was pretty empty when we came around 11:30, but the place is very large, so I suppose they don't fill up to capacity during the weekday.  

We started off with truffled potato chips with maytag blue cheese fondue for $7.  Pretty yummy and very oily.  Good thing all 6 of us at the table shared it as our appetizer.  

For my lunch, I went for the Italian fennel sausage pizza for $15.  It was very large, but I ate the whole thing because I am a piggy.  The pizza was tasty, but also quite salty and oily.  I wanted to try a pizza because that is what they are known for, but I think if I ever went back to Wolfgang Puck's, I would try to get something healthier next time.  

The restaurant itself is quite nice and upscale, and the service is very good.  It's located in the middle of a very large and nice outdoor mall.  Too bad I didn't get to check out the rest of the mall, but the little bit that we saw while walking through looked quite nice.

Went there with my wife on Friday night 11/4 around 8:00 pm.
Place was crowded but we got a seat.
After 10 minutes, I had to flag down the manager to take our order.
My wife ordered a glass of wine and the manager poured it in her glass and spilled it on the table in the process.
I was washing my hands in the bathroom at the time this happened.
I flagged down our server and asked if she could please get me a towel so I could wipe up the mess. She said OK, but never came back. I had to flag down the manager again and ask for a new napkin because I used mine to wipe up the mess.
Food was good but expensive. 2 apps, 1 glass of wine and one entree was $69.00.

This is the 2nd time we came here  and the last time we left after 10 minutes because no one came to take our order.

This is probably the last time we come here.

Too many other choices.

Our food came out hot and fresh but I think it wasn't worth the money. The portion of the calamari was quite small. Although I really love their Chicken Nachos. It was delicious and very filling. My husband said it was ok. I also ordered Jameson and Ginger Ale. The bartender put too much whiskey and not enough ginger so it was too strong. I ordered iced tea the second round so that was good for me. 

Overall, Happy Hour was good. It's a busy place with friendly service.

Very disappointed in tonight's dinner and service. Server stopped by twice - take our order and deliver the bill. Pizza was burnt! Manager took the pizza off the tab. Unlikely we'll return any time soon.
Stopped in for a little lunch .. great spot to eat outside. Highly recommend the Damin dill pizza and bell pepper burger to die for !!

Dined here on vacation in April with friends. Very good location and many options for seating including outdoors on the patio, in the open concept dining room, or at the bar. The wine selection was very good and the food choices were predictably top shelf. Some complain about the portion sizes being small, but they were decent and not the spot of food in the middle of a large plate you often come across.

This place has one of the best happy hours! The staff is always friendly. Clean restaurant and fresh food. The happy hour menu has a wide range to choose from. I always enjoy the sangria with the truffle chips and sweet potato fries. I do recommend this place, if you are seeking a nice calm atmosphere with great food.

This was our 2nd time going to this location and the 1st time was better than this time. The service was just ok and the food was too. 

Ordered:
Meatballs 4/5 stars 
Tender, juicy, and full of flavor. The sauce was amazing. I couldn't give it a 5 stars because I asked for extra basil and cheese and they did not bring it out that way. :-(

Margarita pizza with sausage added: 2/5 stars 
The pizza came out with no sausage ;-( 
the waiter took it back to the kitchen and came out 2 secs later so the sausage was just thrown on top :-( 
The lack of cheese was so disappointing. :-(

Fish and chips: 3/5 
My boyfriend order this dish and he said it was good. Nothing was great about it to give it more than 3 stars. Fish was flaky and the fries were nice and crispy.

What a great place to have lunch. I brought a few clients here and our expectations were not only met but exceeded. A big thank you to the staff, especially Jason for the excellent service he provided during our experience. I/We will definitely be repeat business. Thanks again!

Food was good but very very small portions during happy hour. 
Service was so good when we first walked in at 430. Then all hell broke loose. 
The service just went into the toilets at shift change. They could care less about us. Not one of the two bartenders gave us any consideration. They only serve regulars. And at this rate regulars will be extinct soon.

The DTS hidden gem! Isn't a bad thing on the menu. If you are a foodie, head over.  You won't be disappointed and with the addition of Auggie managing the staff the last 4-5 months, the service has totally turned around.
Our meal and service was awesome! Shawna was our server and she was very attentive and great! Will be back again!

There is a Sunday dinner that for $25/per person for a minimum of 4 people you get amble food family style.   There is a pizza, salad, cheese and salami board, pasta, sea bass, ribs, cookies, and carrot cake.   The food was great.  However we all felt a bit rushed.   As we were enjoying our first course, they were being told that the food for the second course was ready.   Thus, there was a bit of a rush feeling which impacted the overall experience.  However the food was excellent.  I will probably return and try it again.

I ordered the braised short ribs and they were pretty darn good. However considering the price and service I'm giving it a 4 star which is still good, but not too notch for me. Being a Wolfgang location and also in Vegas you're paying for the name. Our server was pretty good but didn't check on us very much and that surprised me as it wasn't that busy and it is a little higher end location. The service wasn't bad just would expect a little more attention.  I also ordered the Nutella skillet cake and it was average. The consistency was soft and gooey which was nice but I didn't feel there was much more taste than when I eat Nutella out of the jar. One thing I think they should change is to allow their happy hour to extend from the bar area into the restaurant itself. The cocktail I had was also average and to be expected pricey. I would go back here but I feel like there are other places where I can get amazing food at cheaper price points.

Had a great experience dining at the new Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill in DT Summerlin.  Everyone in our party enjoyed the homemade chips  and blue cheese sauce.  The tuna tartare was outstanding.  The service was great for a restaurant that only opened several days ago.  The monkey bread for dessert was delicious.  Great selection of wines and great vibe for DT Summerlin!

When all is said and done, it's the manager who makes the difference.

We were 9 people out for Happy Hour, just looking to have a good time.  The saga has a pretty happy ending, but for most of the time it was a struggle to get the waiter to attend to us properly.  He was definitely poorly trained, which wouldn't have shocked me if this was Joe's Coffee Shop, but c'mon, it's Wolfie's (no, not the old place in Florida).

He was abrupt, not sticking around long enough to fully explain our orders, giving us a rush job, and generally being inattentive and unfriendly.  A few of us ordered burgers, all cooked medium.  This isn't the waiter's fault (I think), but all of them came out still attached to the cow, dripping blood, which was shocking.  

Enter the manager, Brad Street.  He took charge, making sure we got our burgers replaced and whipping our table into fine shape.  To make up for the rotten service, he comped us some delectable desserts and a few drinks.

Now for the kicker:  We got a single check for the table, which we paid using two different credit cards, one of which was ours.  We asked the waiter to put $120 on our card, which would include our portion of a generous tip.  He returned and said he couldn't do that, because the amount, along with what was being put on the other card, was more than the bill. Strange, but we decided to leave the tip money in cash.

The very next day my husband checked our CC account online and discovered that the waiter had indeed charged our card for the full $120, obviously pocketing the extra, in addition to the cash that was left.  He went right to the restaurant and explained what had happened.  Brad made reparations immediately, and assured us that he would be speaking to the waiter, as well as adding some much-needed training.  

And that's why I've decided to give Wolfgang Puck four stars, bloody burgers notwithstanding.  It's possible it was the chef, but equally possible that the waiter never communicated - or miscommunicated - our requests for edible meat.  We had a good time, the other food was very good, and we'll be returning.

Raspberry Lemon Drop Martini was lovely.... not to sweet...... delish!!
Big Eye Tuna Tartare was very good, but I LOVED the Mushroom Pizza. 
Pizza had lots of mushroom, mozzarella, arugula, and a perfectly cooked fried egg on top. Pizza crust was perfectly cooked as well, crunchy bottom but not hard or chewy....Yummy!!!
I will definitely be back for that pizza!
I wish I had took a pic, because it looked as good as it tasted.

I went here earlier in January for lunch, and I only had the tortilla soup, which was excellent.  The service was top notch, and I was greeted the second I walked in the door and was seated immediately.  It was just a quick lunch meeting, but I will definitely be back for a bigger lunch.

I ate here on a Friday night w my friend. We got there right at 5pm so there was no wait. It did fill up as we were eating dinner so get there early if you don't want to wait...though it didn't appear like the wait would've been very long if we had come later.

Our server was very nice & professional right off the bat. I had to wait a few minutes for my friend to arrive so he got us waters & was nice about waiting.

We ordered the house sangria to start. It was very good but not strong at all. We also ordered the crab louie appetizer and charred snap peas (a side) as a second app. Both were amazing. The crab louie was just delicious. Only regret was we were sharing because I could've easily eaten the whole thing. So good! The charred snap peas came with a harissa yogurt sauce that made the dish. It was so good. We actually save that sauce to put on our main dishes. The bread was also very good - crusty on the outside & soft inside.

We both ordered salads. I got the kale & spinach and I added salmon. My friend got the chopped and added chicken. My salmon was cooked perfectly but we both agreed that the salads we so-so. They weren't bad, just not wow like we expected after the delicious apps.

Throughout the meal we had great service. I also saw the manager throughout the evening interacting w guests & checking on meals. Overall thumbs up & I'll definitely be back...for the crab louie!

I just wasn't that impressed - small, uninspired menu and food that simply isn't worth the price point.  They are serving the exact same items as next door at CPK - except at Puck's you get half the food for almost twice as much.  The margherita pizza I had was terribly bland - they were very stingy on the basil and cheese.

Only thing that kept my review at 3 stars is that the service was very good.  But I would not go back and I would not recommend this place to anyone else.

Had the mushroom pizza and chicken parm. The parm was really tasty but the noodles were drenched in butter. That's about all you could taste unfortunately, but like I said, the chicken itself was good.

The mushroom pizza was lame... it's like they stuck the mushrooms in the fryer first to cook them or something bc it was ultra greasy. 

The staff was really friendly but the food could not be justified for the price. Was more like fast food but for $60.

Came here tonight again for dinner because we had such a great dinner last time and yet again we had another awesome dining experience. 

THE FOOD: Dish 1:  Rigatoni pasta Turkey Bolognese. Best dish we had tonight. So good. Loved the whipped Basil Ricotta in the middle. 

Dish 2: Pork Snitziel. This dish was also very good. Big portions. The mustard sauce completed the taste of this filling dish. 

Dish 3:  Salmon. Mom really loved it and said she would order it again when she comes back. 

Dish 4: My sister got the Pasta Di Orecchiette. Very good pasta dish. Perfect mix of meat and veggies. 

Dish 5: Mac and Cheese for my niece. It was so so. Not cheesy enough. 

THE SERVICE: Zoe was our server tonight. She was very helpful and courteous. Didn't have to ever wait too long for anything. And Brad the manager was also very hospitable and treated our table well. 

Had a great dinner tonight. Definitely recommend for anyone who wants to come to eat good food and have great service. The sports playing on the tv's at the bar is an additional plus!

It's just bad!  We went here for thanksgiving dinner and when I made the reservations they said the cost would be $29 per person for the Turkey dinner and that one plate would probably be enough for two.

Well, the cost was $33.00 per person, the plate was skimpy and I could not eat the turkey,  The service was very poor.  Our server was very inattentive.  We had to ask for things like bread a couple of times.  I would not recommend this restaurant.

Pretty good spot to grab a bite if you're up in the Downtown Summerlin mall area!

Like Wolfgang's other places, this restaurant is consistent and also offers of good selection of tasty delights.  

For my drink, I had the daily healthy fresh pressed juice.  Today's special was spinach, kale, celery, ginger, orange, and apple.  It's not bad combo and tasted alright.

For the appetizer we had the calamari, roasted vegetable pizza, and a side of french fries.  The calamari was awesome, two sauces for you to dip your calamari and some battered veggies as well.  The roasted pizza was very good as well, the broccolini added a nice texture to the pizza.  Normally I like a meaty type of pizza, but for a change I decided to try the roasted vegetable pizza and I'm glad I did.  Nothing special about the fries, skinny type fries, but the nice thing is the side of fries is a nice hearty portion and great for sharing.

For dinner we had the mushroom pasta and a side of broccolini.  The mushroom pasta had great flavor, but the one thing I wasn't a fan of was some of the pasta had clumps of salt which made it really salty for some bites.  The brocolini stir fry side was a nice compliment to the meal, a little subtle spicy kick to it.  

As for dessert, we had the apple crotada.  Basically, a fresh baked open faced apple pastry with a side of vanilla ice cream.  Since it's fresh baked, it takes a few minutes longer.  This was really good, the pastry was very flaky and warm right out of the oven.  The apples weren't too sweet and a little tart which I like.  Definitely a dessert I'd get again.

Service at the table was pretty good.  The odd thing is with the hostess, we got there and had to sit at the community table since we didn't make a reservation per the hostess even though 80% of the restaurant wasn't full at that time.  Even after we were done with our meal, paid and got up to leave the main dining area they had about 40% of the main dining area open not counting the outside patio dining area that no one really sat at since it's cold outside.  It seemed odd to push people to the community table to sit next to each other when it wasn't super busy.  Maybe the hostess was still training, but I'd recommend making a reservation given our experience if you and your party want a more private dining experience.
The pizza and salad were wonderful. The crispy crust and cheesy balance were perfect! They had some of the most attentive staff in this area!

I've dined here several times since they've opened. I can't say I've had a bad experience. The service can be spotty, but generally it's pretty decent.

I agree that the menu is limited, but I believe most people should be able to find something to enjoy. I've tried a variety of items:

The burger (good)
Spaghetti and meatballs (very good - homemade pasta that is, yes, cooked al dente)
Half rotisserie chicken - tasty, and I'm not a huge chicken fan
Special BLT type of sandwich at lunch - EXCELLENT

I've also heard from other diners that all of pasta dishes on the menu are very good.

The only dessert I've tried is the pineapple upside down cake, and it's been good.

For a non-alcoholic treat, try their Ginger-Lime Iced Tea. It's amazing!

The wine list is more limited than I would like, but I suppose it matches the menu variety. :)

The atmosphere is nice, the front desk staff is always super-friendly, and the location is really convenient for me. I do consider this one of my regular local restaurants and recommend you give it a try.

Great food! The Mahi Mahi tacos are melt in your mouth delicious! ! The turkey burger, the Margherita pizza and the Mac-n-cheese are all great!! The cocktails, the service and the dining are worth it!!
Staff seem like deer in headlights. Not friendly.  Food is ok over priced. Don't get me wrong  I don't mind paying for good service and good food.  So yeah it's eh.  Not impressed.
The food tasted pretty good here but every time I've gone the service has been absolutely terrible. The staff get orders confused all the time and are extremely slow as well

First of all I will say this place is excellent!! If you tried it when they first opened, give them another chance because they've worked out some kinks. The burger is fantastic and the pastas are all made in-house! Sure the seating arrangements are strange, get a table...not a low boy or one of the bar tables. Managers are accommodating and service is great. It's one of the best places to dine in Summerlin!!
Good tasting food, fast service, fun environment and can't help but saying the staff is good looking! Must try

The Holy Grail of huevos rancheros.  I've been searching all over Las Vegas for halfway decent huevos for years!  

Crispy tortilla shells, layered with a well-spiced sauce, black beans, eggs and guacamole. Not a huge serving, so eat slowly. But excellent flavors. 

Wife ordered egg croissant. Side salad is very fresh and the size is nice. But the dressing is overly sour for the dish. When fresh greens are slightly bitter to start with, this became too much. Wife LOVED the eggs. They were sooo fluffy. Ham is good, but a bit salty. The egg, ham and arugula in one bite is delicious, so keep your plate organized. And ask them to warm the croissant first. 

Wife had ordered the spaghetti and meatballs, but sent it back. The sauce was excellent...but the meatballs were cold inside and the spaghetti was gummy. It was almost under-done on the inside. 

Last time, wife had had pasta with seafood, and the pasta was gummy also. She ended up eating the seafood and leaving her pasta. Just in case you're not reading carefully:  DO NOT ORDER PASTA HERE. 

Service is on point, but that's to be expected at a Puck spot.

I love their trendy setting. Took about 10 min to be seated, which is not bad being I went on a Friday night around 7:30pm. I offered the Pearfect Martini, very delicious and included vodka and pear syrup.  For appetizer we ordered the chips with warm truffle cheese and blue cheese crumbles, very good. As well we had the fried calamari, the marinara sauce was also great. And finally me and my friend split the papardelli pasta with ox meat, good thing we did because the entree would of being too big for just me. The ox meat is shredded, and you can tell the pasta is home made which the server did confirm. 

I wish I remember the server's name but I was impressed that at the end of our meal he came up to me and asked me about the food but actually then asked me to really critique it and mention what we didn't like or could of been better. I said the chips had a good amount of cheese but I personally would of liked more cheese. And for the calamari it could of been a little more crisper, but still very good. And I had no complaint at all about the papardelli.

This restaurant is good. The bleu cheese potato chips are super good and about the only thing I go there for. The service can be spotty when you're there depending on the day, especially in the bar area. It's a nice place to drop in for something small.

Not sure on the reasoning for some of the poor reviews but this is one of the better meals in Downtown Summerlin. Nice relaxed atmosphere, clean, good quality dishes at a reasonable price point. I've been here for all 3 meals and they have all been good.

One of our favorite places. Never disappoints we had the taster tots to start and they were crispy and brown and covered in blue cheese. My son had the flank steak and it was cooked
Medium rare as requested and was seasoned perfectly. It's amazing how many places can't cook a steak right but they do here. My wife had the  Pizza. It was good, she had the cheese this time, after having the pepperoni last time. I had the salmon and it was so good. Crispy on the outside and soft in the middle. Love a fish with a crust. Came with arugula salad and a bean ragout. The bean ragout was just ok, some were pretty hard. I ordered a side of Mexican street corn and it was so delicious it more than made up for the bean ragout. Seasoned with a chili lime and cheese it was so good I ate every kernel. We'll be back again soon I'm sure!

Wolfgang Puck's Bar and Grill is my favorite restaurant in town. I was very happy to hear that they were putting one in downtown Summerlin. We ate there the day after they opened and the food was delicious. The staff was cheerful and friendly which is what I have come to expect in any Wolfgang Puck establishment. We had a wonderful evening. The Ambience wasn't great - it was kind of industrial chic. I hope they put up some photos like they have at the other Wolfgang Puck bar and Grill in town otherwise it could have been any restaurant. As it is now, the only way you would know you were dining at Wolfgang Puck's bar and Grill is because of the friendly service and the delicious food - which is okay by me.

Took my kids for lunch. We had burgers. Perfect! Best burgers ever with perfect seasoning. Our waiter was an immature Millennial ass who provided terrible service, otherwise I would give them 5 stars which is a rarity for me. We will try again and ask for another waiter.

Moving from 2 stars to 3 from my previous visit. Can't say enough about the friendly and great service we received from the staff. 

The calamari and shrimp appetizer was really good. All the other lunch items were as mediocre as our entrees from our first visit. Disappointing and based on other reviews it seems that this is a hit or miss experience. Down the road I might consider a return visit.

This place had terrible pizza.  And wings/ calamari are just standard previously frozen appetizers. Take a look at the pizza pic. That was with "extra basil" I paid for. Ended up just getting it all to go and paid the bill before I got the food where I gave a $15 tip and they didn't even show me the food or check it themselves. 

And you know once you get home it's to late to pack up your kids and go back... The waitress was nice but she and I should have checked the order.

The Place and food are about the same or less then that of a little Caesars or dominoes lol. They also turn the lights up and down while we where there for some reason. 

Step up your food game Wolf Gang Puck! And with your prices and notoriety this is your end product !? Disappointed man disappointed and let down. What a waste of money. Never going to take my wife and or kid here again. 

You should be embarrassed with that pizza! There are several small places here in town that know how to make a Margherita pizza with fresh basil and know what extra basil actually means. You should try them out, maybe take some notes. 

And why are you going so sparingly on the cheese? Is the cheap cheese, olive oil, garlic budget that tight lol?

Fun menu, good service, really enjoyed it! The Tangerine Mojito is sweet and refreshing. I had the Chinese Chicken Salad and my Mom had the Fish Tacos. The best part was the truffled potato chips with blue cheese sauce.
Great service. Food was amazing. Lawrence our server was FABULOUS! Will most definitely be back and recommend to others!

Stopped for lunch and was extremely pleased-
Ordered a pizza and got my daughter some Mac and cheese-  could tell everything was fresh and made to order.  
Staff was very friendly and attentive without being over bearing.  Environment was clean and relaxing.  A bit loud due to openness and the modern industrial style but also due to being slightly busy.
Loved the open kitchen design and bar feature areas

I love happy hours but this was a not so happy hour. First, the service was slow, (although the server we had was very nice). The calamari was undercooked, there were no joke 10 pieces maybe. The TBG meatballs were ok but looked pink on the inside. The Hot Tater Tots were literally microwaveable Tater tots splashed with some buffalo sauce and bleu cheese. We also ordered the "salt and pepper" chicken wings expecting salt and pepper wings but got what looked like buffalo wings. See attached picture. We asked 3 different waiters if they were sure this was the salt and pepper wings and they all looked confused and said yes. Maybe I'm wrong but all the other pics of s&p wings look like actual s&p. To top it off we spent $30 plus and ended up going to shake shack across the way. Save your money and go somewhere else for happy hour. Ok, rant over :)

Happened to go by for lunch again when family was in town recently.  The first experience there was no fluke.  This place is on point.  And they have George T Stagg bourbon!  Just when I thought it couldn't get any better.

I just want to say that the team at this restaurant does a phenomenal job. I have held two parties at this establishment, as well as a business dinner. Every time the service has been over the top and the food has been great. The staff shows every time was truly great customer service is supposed to look like. I have had many options here, but I love the salmon the best. It is always cooked to perfection with the right amount of crispiness to the outside. The yellow and green beans that come with are fantastic as well and provide a unique taste with the salmon. Their pizza is also one of a kind and I always hope to take some home to enjoy for the remainder of the week when we get to eat there. The blue cheese chips are phenomenal! I am not generally a huge blue cheese fan, but I these are down right awesome. The blueberry upside down cake is a great desert and most importantly the CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIES! Holy Moly! They are great. I really appreciate the team and the management at this location and will continue to bring my family, business and parties here again and again!

Food was very bland. Also, overpriced based on the size of my dish. The wine I was served was so awful I wouldn't have used it as a cooking wine. Disappointed in that this isn't even comparable to Spago. Wolfgang himself would have been irate.

This place should be better because represents the Wolfgang restaurants?  On the strip his restaurants are so much better.Pizza is not really good.I prefer Grimaldis pizza.
Work on the clean silverware. It was so dirty.The waiter was careless about service. Not for me.Grimaldis im Coming back
Overpriced! Blah food best bet is to go next door to Crave (which is amazing) but had to try it once. We won't back ;-(

Great ambiance, excellent food, terrible service. Located in downtown Summerlin this restaurant is in a great location. The design is open and airy and with lots of natural light and a great outdoor dining area. The food we had was wonderful w/ excellent salads, martini's (when they finally arrived), trout cooked perfectly and a "steak frites" w/ a decadent herb butter topping - but the wait service...terrible.  Slow in greeting the table, took forever to get cocktails, sloppy presentation of the food when it came out - and all of this in an empty restaurant. My guess is it's a management issue...who knows, but for a higher end restaurant you expect more.

This is getting one star because they are good at making substitutions for allergies and diet restrictions. Other than that the food is super expensive for not very good quality. I was starving after I finished my meal since the chicken was mostly skin, bones, and fat. No one in our group was happy with their food but at least it was edible.

I've eaten at Wolfgang Puck restaurants in Los Angeles and Las Vegas.  The food here was good - up to standard.  The service wasn't. 

I arrived 3p for a late, leisurely lunch.  The bar was occupied by 3 other guests but the remaining spots were dirty - dishes and place mats from previous occupants.   I took one of these spots and the bartender (working furiously) assured me he would clean it shortly.  I left 90 minutes later and all 3 additional bar diners got the same experience.  They sat at dirty seats and waited quite a while for service.  Where was the manager??? 

Once I got to order, the food came quickly and it was delicious.  But my experience (leisurely lunch) was punctuated by a bartender constantly on the run, waiting on everyone in the restaurant and working furiously to keep up.  Getting his attention was difficult because he was so busy, but he was also extremely polite once caught. 

Whomever manages this location was content to let him flounder for an hour and a half this afternoon while patrons paid the price.  Not a great experience, especially specially at a chain that prides itself on delivering an exceptional customer experience.
