They were very busy when I arrived at lunchtime and was seated fairly quickly despite a mix up over my reservation, which I later realized was my fault. We counted 30 plus staff, about 1:1 ratio to the customers dining inside. No doubt just for the opening until things get settled. 

The focaccia bread was nice and my Summerlin Sour was a nice, tasty drink without being too strong, which was fine since it was lunchtime. The recc'd truffled potato chips w bleu cheese fondue was way too salty for me and not strong enough bleu cheese. We asked for the mac n cheese instead and were graciously accommodated. The pasta was fine and al dente, but the sauce was a bit bland and runny. More importantly, the crock it came in was barely lukewarm; mac n cheese should always be hot! We gently pointed this out and our waitress immediately said it would not be on our bill.

For the entrees, my partner loved his hamburger and two bites of it showed me that it was cooked perfectly med rare (although actually, he wasn't asked how he'd like it), very juicy, and flavorful. My pappardelle w oxtail ragout was also al dente but the thickness was a bit too heavy handed and there was very little oxtail. But because the service was so on point, they had just opened, and the burger was so tasty, I am awarding 4 stars and will be back next week to give them another shot!

This was to be the last hurrah meal during the weekend in Vegas.  Since I had grown tired of dealing with Strip traffic, I nudged my travel companions to checkout Summerlin since I knew it'd be quieter yet as (if not more) upscale than the Strip.  I was not disappointed! 

I had been to a Wolfgang Puck concept in Tulsa, OK a few years back and greatly enjoyed the dish I had (bacon-wrapped meatloaf and mash potatoes), and I found the food just as scrumptious at this bar & grill.  We were greeted by friendly waitstaff as we entered and asked our preference on seating.  We chose the patio as the restaurant wasn't packed.

My dining companions ordered bottomless mimosas (affordably priced!) and enjoyed swift refills.  We ordered brunch food and all had positive reviews on the taste and quality.  I in particular had french toast which had the consistency of funnel cake yet blew my mind!  It was a bizarre combination of high and low but it totally worked.  The toast was served with traditional maple syrup and a berry sauce.  The funnel cake style french toast was so savory that I only used the raspberry sauce and abstained from the syrup.  I also ordered a side of bacon which was acceptable as expected.  

While the food should always be the star of a Wolfgang Puck grill, I found the atmosphere and service to be the standouts.  The patio was designed with foot traffic in mind and we were seated at an adequate distance from our neighbors so as to not invade their space. Seating was comfortable and our metal table was sturdy.  The interior of the restaurant was spacious with a modern flair (lots of steel and smooth industrial floors).  Lastly, we didn't have to flag down our server ever and checkout was a breeze.  Recommended with gusto!
I would give it a zero. Their time said they close at 10, I arrive with a party of 6 at 9:10 and they said they were closed. Guess they don't want my money. Lost customers forever.

Completely biased..by just the fact that they have a doggie friendly patio...this restaurant rocks..
Beef burger and turkey burger....very good, and soooo much better food than the other doggie friendly near by patio....
So....if you have an option with doggie in tow...this is a much more viable human experience.

We expected more considering this has the name of "WOLFGANG"
The Margherita pizza we had the dough is so tough on that you can barely eat the crust. 
We also had a pasta dish.

 We place the order and no kidding this order was out within six or seven minutes.... The pasta was not very hot, I'm not sure if the stuff is premade and they throw it together or what?  
Definitely not impressed.

Wolfgang Puck is a nice brunch establishment in downtown Summerlin.  Their brunch menu is a little small however it has a few options for everyone to choose from. As an appetizer my brother ordered the French toast which was on large Texas style toast bread and it was more than enough to feed our party of four and to have a huge portion of leftovers as well. My cousin thought the burger was okay, as it was a little hard to eat due to it being a little bit overly messy for one to eat. I enjoyed the steak as it was cooked with flavor and was tender.

This is one of my favorite whenever restaurants. They change the pastas that they make from scratch and everyone I've tried, I have loved. Their pizzas are really good too. Salads are fresh. Their cookies are delicious! I've brought family and friends and they all of it!

Great spot up in the Summerlin area. Food has always been great and service is always on point. Was just told that the Happy Hour now ends at 7pm. One of the many reasons the wife and I would make any excuse to come here. Well, guess we'll just have to come and catch it if we're here at the right time.

Update: Near the end of our visit, we were awaiting for our server to come check on is again. I wanted a refill on my ice tea and the wife was looking forward to another sangria. Well, needless to say we didn't see our server again until another 30 minutes (or so) and by that time, we were just ready to leave. We flagged down the hostess and voiced our concern and then a few minutes later a manager came and spoke with us. We were going to just brush it off but since we've been coming here I figured they should be offered the opportunity to know and be able to fix it. Again, food is good and the service is always great but that evening our server just gave us the impression that they wanted nothing to do with us. I hope their management gets it together and soon.

The Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill doesn't officially open until November 5, 2014, according to the wolfgangpuck.com website, but I was lucky to stumble in on their soft opening a day early. All the head honchos were in attendance, from Wolfgang's "right-hand" man to the executive chef of Wolfgang Puck (as told to us by our waiter). Customer service, to say the least, was on point. All hands were on deck, and no one was left wanting.

Complimentary bread infused with herbs and olive oil was served in an adorable wooden bowl. The bread was incredibly soft, thick, and flaky too! We told our waiter to keep those bad boys coming. :) 

For starters, I shared the artisanal cheese and salami plate ($16) with my better half. I was surprised that the plate came with only 2 types of cheeses, and was hoping for something grandiose due to the hefty price tag. When the plate arrived on top of a weathered cheese board, the pickings were slim. Call me plain, but the cheeses, sauces, and adornments on the plate were too "fancy" (i.e., overwhelmingly powerful and distinct) for my palate.  

My husband ordered the mesquite burger for $13, which is damn cheap for the quality. He was ultimately only able to finish half the burger, so it was decent sized. I was told the burger was juicy, too. The fries were plentiful, fresh, and warm. I had to restrain myself from eating all his fries! There was only one snafu: he had to send the burger back because he ordered it medium well but was presented with a medium rare burger. The kitchen was quick to fix the problem and the manager himself came to our table not only to apologize, but insisted despite our protests that our dinner would be taken care of.  

I ordered the rigatoni dish minus the turkey bolognese sauce ($15), opting for a tomato based sauce instead. The sauce was perfectly creamy and the dish was overall extremely filling. 

The standard of customer service displayed here at Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill was unreal. The waiter literally helped seat me by scooting me in my chair and dropped a napkin across my lap. Our waiter was extremely attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable on every menu item we asked about. My water glass was never empty and the employees frequently checked up on us to make sure everything was okay. I think my silverware was changed at least three times. Plates were cleared off almost immediately - it was like magic! When the waiter cleared our cheese plate from the table, he picked up a miniscule crumb of cheese off my husband's place mat (seriously). I was over the moon about the whole customer service experience. 

To sum everything up:
Ambiance: 4
Food: 4
Customer Service: 5+

I didn't save room for dessert, but the Monkey Bread was highly recommended by the staff. I will definitely come back to this new Wolfgang Puck location in Downtown Summerlin. I'm salivating over what I imagine the Monkey Bread will taste like, and would love to try the pizza next time! Customer service quality alone makes a return visit necessary, and is why I rated Wolfgang 5 stars. I hope that their standards for customer service will remain unchanged after some time passes. Keep up the good work!

Came here on my moms 50th birthday! The atmosphere was excellent, lights were dim and staff members were friendly! I saved $41 because when you check in using Yelp you get 20% off your tab! I love the cocktail drinks here! Food was extravagant also! Well prepared dishes! Our waitress was very attentive!

I went here for a little birthday celebration with my friend. We sat outside and it was a beautiful day in Las Vegas so very enjoyable. We got the margarita pizza and the macaroni and cheese. The pizza was sooo delicious. We got the smaller size and split it which was perfect for 2 people (3 small slices per person) The macaroni was good, but not the best I've ever had. I was celebrating my birthday here, so we got a slice of key lime pie with a candle. I don't like key lime pie (personal preference) so I don't really know if it was good or bad, but my friend enjoyed it. The only problem with my meal was my waitress. Our waitress never asked for our order or greeted us after waiting about 10-15 mins, so we asked another server if they could get our order and he did and was so friendly and pleasant. The food was good, but my waitress in particular was eh. (The rest of the staff was great)

Went there for lunch, saw that they had allergy menu,  but the only thing was that bartender staff during happy hour did not understand my allergy and messed up my order twice .   They need to make sure staff understands allergies and what cross contaminated is , So I got a couple avocado rolls and left

This is our new favorite spot! The bartenders rock, and are always so attentive. I love the chicken salad sandwich and warm donuts! During brunch they also have the best grapefruit juice. They just started happy hour from 3-close with awesome munchies and drink specials.
I tried both their locations, on the strip and in summerlin. The food on the strip tastes better. I was a bit disappointed with their food in the summerlin location.

Food was great, super yummy. Service was awful though, super disappointed again. I wanted my family to try this place because the food is great and they don't have Wolfgang Puck everywhere but I am definitely not coming back again. There literally were no other tables aside from us and our waiter did not care to ask us if we were okay, for refills, and it took her forever to even come to our table in the first place. You pay 100 dollars for a meal and you expect a little better service, don't you think? I guess just stick to CUT by Wolfgang Puck, they have way better service but it's also at the strip and you are spending about 400 + dollars for your meal so maybe they train them better there.

We decided to take our pup to the mall because he loves it there and couldn't decide where to eat. As we were getting closer to Wolfgang's all I could hear were barking dogs on the patio and I new this was my spot. Everyone sitting on the patio on Sunday had a dog or 2 with them. I love that they are so welcoming of dogs here. They even bring out big bowls of ice water.

Bri was our waitress and she is a dog lover. Bri brought us the menu and had those bottomless mimosas at our table in seconds. This was our first time here and Bri gave us some great recommendations. We ordered all of them. And I love the fact that Bri was honest and told us the large pizza was too big for just the 2 of us since we were ordering other things. 

We ordered the Huevos Rancheros w/ Black Beans. I order this at every restaurant because it is always different. This was excellent-- I have never had it where the tortillas were crunchy like a tostada. I would go back just for this meal.

Next up was the Small Smoked Salmon Pizza w/ dill cream, red onions and a little dollop of caviar. I did like this pizza but it had way too much salmon on it for me. The BF loved it and ate most of it. If I ordered it again I would probably order it with light salmon. I know that sounds weird but just my preference.

The grand finale was the Truffle Potato Chips w/ Blue Cheese. Yes you read that right. TRUFFLE POTATO CHIPS. Woo Hoo- they were so good. Chips tasted homemade and the the blue cheese sauce was very light and just everywhere. They were perfect. 

You can never go wrong with bottomless mimosas so we made sure to take full advantage of the bottomless. This restaurant is really beautiful and I love the patio seating. It was so nice and relaxing. I love that it's in the back and you don't get the mall crowd walking by staring at you.

Go check this place out, sit outside and ask for Bri. We will be back for sure.

Loud... Loud.... Loud.
This restaurant is very loud. At 6:30 they ran out of the braised beef and since they were out I asked the waiter what's the next best thing. My wild boar pasta was good. Unfortunately, the hubby's $33 flat iron steak was not done properly. Paid $178 for a dinner without dessert. Hmm... Not so good. Not planning to come back.

I was so impressed with this place from start to finish. Our server Lawrence was beyond excellent his attention to detail was refreshing! I was with a party of three and every item we ordered was superb I particularly like the heirloom tomatoes!

My friend and I had dinner here recently and enjoyed our meal! It was a busy Friday night and the restaurant seemed overcrowded...it was very loud, like difficult to hold a conversation (and we were in the back cot era)...great bustling atmosphere but not great for conversation. Service was a little slow--they seemed overwhelmed by the crowd...But water and drinks were refilled quickly.

We decided to try several things. We both got the chopped salad with champagne vinagrette...amazing! It is enough for two to share, or add chicken for an entree. We will go back specifically for that salad! 

We had the cheese plate as well- unimpressive and overpriced. Do not recommend.

Instead of doing main courses, we ordered two sides to go with our salads. Mac and cheese is to die for...we loved it. We also got the broccoli I which was nicely seasoned with garlic and chilis...


Overall, great spot for a nice lunch or casual dinner...however, if you are looking for a more intimate, fine dining experience I would go somewhere else.

We will be back!

Mac and Cheese was amazing, the Truffle potato chips were good too. Service was excellent,  Really can't say anything was bad about the place. A much better vibe than dining on the strip. This location caters to locals. Very happy with the new addition to Summerlin

We'll.... me and my daughter had dinner here, place was very clean, the staff was super friendly and nice... I order a simple soda sprite and it was flat and nasty not good...I was little disappointed about that,and than I order the chicken wings very good and spicy but I order Blue cheese and they dint have it so they had to make up one and it was noooot...good. It tasted like sour cream and cheese and was not good, we had the Margarita pizza it was really good.

Outstanding service. Great food, as one might expect from a Wolfgang Puck restaurant. I always had the steak. My server heard about my bad day and offered me a glass of champagne because I couldn't decide between champagne and Pinot Noir. 

One downside is they always close early. But the location in MGM is open til 6am!

This was my first time eating at a Wolfgang Puck restaurant and the experience was lovely! The food was fresh & delicious, well-prepared, & reasonably priced. Definitely gourmet style but in a more casual setting. Service was excellent too!

This is a review for the Wolfgang Puck Happy Hour

The space and ambiance are amazing - open, trendy, and has outdoor spacing. The space is new so super comfortable and the area is walkable.

I am a sucker for prosecco...and their $5 happy hour prosecco really can't be beat! One of the better proseccos I've tried, all for a whopping $5.

There are 7 food options under $10 for happy hour.  The pizza is on the smaller size (looks like a personal pan pizza) but everything else is shareable and tasty.  

On top of all this, check in on Yelp or scan your TruFusion ID for an additional 20% off!

The only only only thing that would make this a 5 star was if the pizza was better and if they added $1 oysters on the menu =D

Food here is pretty good. A bit pricey but good quality. I had a $25 off two entrees so I got the burger with mac n cheese and the rigatoni. The burger was huge with delicious grilled onions and plenty of melty cheese. I couldn't even finishj it with the side of mac (decent). I got the rigatoni with turkey Bolognese  to go and despite not usually being a pasta fan unless its mac n cheese or Alfredo I actually think I liked this one better. Overall it's not a bad place and If go be k if in the red rock area.

One of the better restaurants in downtown summerlin for sure. Wolfgang your trademark name once again delivers. The restaurant is pretty upscale and even the door to get in is huge and imposing but I definitely dig it. 

Obviously food matters most so lets get right into it:

-Free range chicken wings. I think these are pretty great. I have spoken to people who say otherwise and I get their point, they arent crispy that is true. They have a thick glaze and arent fried but I don't mind that texture. The glaze is great with a small amount of kick. I could eat a lot of these

-Hand made meatballs. Very yummy no question. You can go to all kinds of restaurants and get a meh meatball but this is not one of them. Worth a taste

-Cheese and meat board. Pretty good I'd say. Nothing blew me away but it's cheese and meat and all of them were edible and fairly enjoyable.

-Prosciutto Arugula pizza. I dont see this on the menu so it may have been a special. Not quite my favorite. I've had plenty of these pizzas before and usually like them but the cheese prosciutto and arugula ratios were way off. The arugula amount overpowered everything else and make the pizza bitter.

-Rigatoni Pasta. Delicious and very filling. Bolognese sauce is great as is the ricotta. It's simple and a great meal no question.

So, the place isn't perfect that's for sure. I haven't loved everything I've tried but it's definitely more likely to be a hit than a miss on any given night. I've gone a handful of times and expect to go again. I recommend you do the same.

It's easy for a restaurant to instantly become one of my favorites when one is a perfect location that offers patio seating and a great happy hour! It's a spot where you will often catch me grabbing some small bites that are all under $10 and paired with a glass of the Wolfgang Chardonnay. Happy Hour starts at 3pm and with $2 off any glass of wine, it's really hard to say no. Although I have only sat in the bar area, service has been spot on! You really see the servers and bussers come together to ensure an impeccable experience. 
Recently I was just here for a quick lunch break where my pallet was craving fish Tacos. These are amazing! Covered in a chipotle spice and paired with slaw and a dollop of an aioli sauce, you get all the flavors in one bite - without everything falling out of it (that's the worse). 
Next time, I hope it's the dinner menu that I get to indulge in. Until then, see you at 3pm!

We came here for Mother's Day and the food was great and ambiance was fantastic! Only downfall was the disappearance of our server. He was very nice but for several times, he was nowhere to be found! It was at the end of the night so I'm almost positive that he was doing his closing duties but still, don't leave your tables hanging because you want to get out of there. Speed up the process for closing and be attentive to your last tables so we can pay & leave, then you can finish up your duties and go home!

I can't believe that this is the first time visiting this restaurant in Downtown Summerlin. Michelle our server was upbeat and attentive. Chuck and I were with a friend from Atlanta and we were all pleasantly surprised. Chuck ordered the fried fish and there were three delicious and generous pieces that were perfect (lightly breaded and not oily) simply delicious. My friend from Atlanta ordered a Greek Salad with shrimp. The preparation and presentation were Amazing because The chef was Generous and very creative with the ingredients. I had a new Italian salad salume and it was also excellent . We will definitely return. We loved the decor and ambiance. Perfect atmosphere for a late dinner after a show on the strip. Leave the strip and come to Summerlin Downtown for an outstanding experience.

We had a small business luncheon here recently in a side room of the grill.  The first thing that was odd is the manager refused to put our group together at one table. So, we were forced to divide our group to sit at two separate tables in the side room by ourselves?  The service was not very good for having two servers they struggled with simple drink service.  The only food I heard anyone say was really good was the pasta carbonara.  The special salmon burgers were dry with little dressing and big portion of sweet potato fries that came with ketchup.  Overall, I have experienced better and simply would not return as there are many other dining options in area.

The Margherita pizza is out of this world! It's seriously my new favorite pizza! The sauce is really flavorful and the crust is delicious! Plus, the wood fired pizza oven makes it extra amazing. Okay, enough about that... The waiters and waitresses are very professional and they know their stuff. I also really like the ambiance here. The restaurant has an industrial cool vibe, not too stuffy. The patio is really nice too, when it isn't hot out. The prices are on the high side, but I always get the pizza ($14), so I can't complain.

Just had a great lunch!
Perfect fish tacos! Awesome avocado toast! Yummy chicken salad sandwich!

Came in to buy the fresh bread & decided to stay for lunch. Great idea. Ed, our server, was helpful & attentive!! Thanks Ed!

The food was okay though it isn't worth the price. It's over charging. The service was horrible. My server didn't introduce us special dish or promotion and didn't give us any information about he menu. However, he was very professional with the table which came after us and sat next to us. He let them know what benefits that they could have, what was the special dish. He came back and check this table often but ignored my table and my table was right next to. It's rude and unprofessional. It was horrible server. I tipped him 10% and though he didn't deserve 10% tips at all.

A staple + favorite for us in Summerlin. Ian (server) is EXCELLENT and the food is always fabulous. The rigatoni noodle is FRESH MADE + VEGAN! The salmon is wild caught, which is a difficult find nowadays in restaurants.

Thia was my first time at the Summerlin location, and I fell in love with the place.  We first requested a booth in the rear, but decided to sit in the bar area because it was brighter and more attractive to the eye. That is when we were told it was the Happy Hour area, and we were really Happy!  The menu had only 7 or 8 items for meals and 7 or 8 drink choices. but the choices were good ones.  The truffle fries were divine and we shared calamari, sweet potato fries, a pipette AND the chicken sliders.  We were pleasantly surprised and topped off the evening with a glass of Proseco and a lemon drop Martini. 5 dinner items and 3 cocktails later  (shared) we received a bill for 52.00!!  Great food at an affordable price.
Sunday happy hour..great atmosphere for adults and families.. Definitely in my top 5 for light dining. Will go back soon and check out the full menu at a later date

Can't believe some review.. How people can compare this restaurant to California Pizza Chicken.. How can you compare Cysco Food and Homemade food made by real chef with passion..
Everybody can see the difference between fake tomato sauce and fresh tomato sauce, same for every product used in their kitchen, you can feel it in your plate..

Great restaurant :
-menu change very often
-great service, not the typical fine dining service, just a very friendly service by professional waiter
-family friendly menu with very good Homemade option for kid (no chicken finger from the freezer)
-honest price

You must try...

Usual high quality food, recipes and service one would
 expect from Wolfgang Puck.  Not a big menu insofar as entrées, but the pizzas are divine, appetizers are original and delicious and salads are gr8.  I love the pepperoni pizza, the grilled Spanish octopus and the Chinese chicken salad.  Nice bar and a healthy juice of the day available.  A little pricey for the portions but a welcome addition to Summerlin.

First time here..definitely will come back. The service, food and overall vibe of the space is everythibg you woukd expect from a WP property.

I had the Chinese Chicken Salad and a Baked Sweet Potato..random choices on.my part..but delicious and filling.

Cannot wait to try the rest of the menu.

Visited this place on a quick impromptu trip to Vegas. My friend found the place, and we are soo happy he did. First of all, the pancakes.. the pancakes.. the pancakes!!! Get the pancakes!! Best pancakes I ever had in my life. I also ordered the eggs and potatoes, and those were delicious as well. I usually can't eat a lot all at once..but that didn't even matter here. I will say that I didn't enjoy the mimosa's too much, maybe the brand of champagne wasn't to my taste, but that doesn't take away from my great experience here. The scenery just adds to the perfection, palm trees, outside seating.. its lush and beautiful. I will be back.

The food here is really good as you would expect.  The Chinese Chicken Salad is quite good.    The truffle butter potato chips are a good appetizer to share.   We enjoy sitting on the patio and people watching.   Service is good, but not fast.   This is a leisurely place to dine
Excellent burger.  The blue cheese trufle chips were exceptionally good. One of my new favorite places.

Even though I've work here before  I finally tried their food. The hostess was very friendly and sat our party right away. After being seated our waitress came, she didn't introduce herself but was very knowledgeable about the food when we had questions, she even made recommendations of drinks. I thought the lighting was a bit dark for me, for a large table I thought it should of been brighter like the smaller party that sat next to us that had better lighting. I thought we would receive some bread while we waited for our salads and soups to come out but we didn't. I was facing the kitchen so I was able to see the line. I thought it was weird seeing someone who wasn't in uniform come on line and eat food in front of the customers. Even though it wasn't that busy, I think it was a bit rude. Our food came out and it looked and tasted delicious. I had the chopped salad and thought it was a good portion. I tried the clam chowder and it was pretty good but felt a bit loose? But that's just me. We also got the calamari, which I wish had a bit more calamari. The sauces that came with it went well with it. I thought half of it was a bit salty. There was even a fried lemon and was something different. The wait staff was great, our waters were always filled  and they took our finished plates right away. Our main course came out and it looked and tasted delicious. I had the oxtail pasta, which i forgot the actually name was one of the best pastas I've ever tasted. From the fresh pasta which I've seen them made to the bolanaise oxtail sauce. Would highly recommend. My friend, who had here bday here got the roasted vegetable pizza was pretty good, I actually had a slice and dipped it in the bolanaise sauce. Tasted even better and had her doing the same. After we were finished our waitress noticed it was my friend's bday and brought out a bread pudding with a scoop of ice cream. I love the crunchy top to the bread pudding. Overall our experience was great, especially the wait staff.

What a great addition to the new Downtown Summerlin! 

The first time I went was just for some cocktails with 3 other girls and we sat on the outdoor patio. We loved our large drink selection and the cool vibe they created. 

My second visit was a date night with my husband and another couple. Our server Jason was awesome! He was knowledgable about all the random food questions we had. Which was a lot. As busy as the restaurant was, we got all of our food in a timely manner and everything tasted delicious! Steak, french fries, pizza, chicken, and mashed potatoes. Yummy yummy yummy!

I love everything about this restaurant!!!! The Fritto Misto is absolutely fabulous and one of my favorite appetizers of ALL TIME!!!! You can also get bottomless mimosas on Sunday brunch as well as a killer brunch menu!!!!!! Try the rancheros!!! If you go in for dinner be sure and ask for Randy because he will treat you like family! On point management team as well with Sara and Brad!!!!! Love you guys and will be back FOR SURE!!!!!!!!!!

Do you associate Wolfgang Puck with quality? Do you have high expectations for world renowned chef restaurants? 

Went on a Saturday night and had
Golden Knights Pizza - 2/5 VERY oily 
Mussels
Seafood Pasta - bland, uninspired, and undercooked pasta
Caprese Salad
Meatloaf - overly salty 
Ceviche
Calamari - a few pieces were ridiculously salty

This place exceeded my expectations. The food was amazing, great service and I loved the atmosphere. I will def be back ! I would recommend anyone here even if it's just for drinks or food it's all amazing.

Disappointing lunch.... service so-so...inattentive, water glasses left unrefilled until had to ask, waited 10 mins for dessert menu which was mia in the restaurant.   Mussels were sandy and flavor bland.   Dessert was truly sloppy ....apple pie.... for $12, I had higher expectations.... not soggy & undercooked puff pastry which seemed to have been heated in a microwave.... Wolfgang, what's up with that!!!

We came in 1 hour before closing and immediately got evil stares from every single staff member and kitchen crew.   The entire restaurant was empty with only 3 other sets of patrons already there.  We waited awkwardly for a while for a host or someone to  seat us.  There was no one in sight and no one even acknowledged that we were standing there waiting. It seemed the staff just wanted us to turn around and leave so they can finish cleaning and go home. 

After we were seated, things seemed to be okay after that awkward moment at the door.  Juan R. served us and he was a good server and made us feel comfortable.  I think he was the only server there with two other tables full of people.  The food, drinks and ambience was great! We enjoyed every dish we ordered and would not hesitate to go back for the food, but I think once is enough and there's other places that seemed more alive and inviting that we will consider next time when we are doing a late Friday night dinner.
You need a new front end staff that actually pays attention to customers. Good thing it's located in downtown summerlin and you have plenty of other options.

Seriously underwhelmed by their Happy Hour!  The pizza was so tiny and the crust tasted frozen.  The Reuben egg rolls had chopped pastrami, maybe it is just me, but the insides looked like throw up - I couldn't get past it.  I'm not sure if drinks are on special because I had to ask for happy hour menu (it was not given to me when I sat down at bar), and then I didn't want to have to ask again.  $38.00 for one person does not seem like a Happy Hour prices...I think I'll stick with Steiner's if I want liquor specials or  Grape Vine Cafe if I want quality happy hour food from now on...

Our first visit to the new Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill was great!  We sat at the bar and we were able to watch football, enjoy some cocktails, and have a lite lunch. My boyfriend enjoyed beer and I ordered Moscow mules as a refreshing drink of choice.  We then shared a margherita pizza and the creamy mac 'n' cheese.  Both were great choices, but wow the creamy mac 'n' cheese is a must try! 

Overall the restaurant is a great choice! Comfortable, relaxing, and enjoyable atmosphere!

This was the second visit to this restaurant.  The first time, we were sat and waited over 10 minutes for someone to come to our table.....so we left.  This time we waited and clearly the staff was busy and took some time getting to us. The food was good, but service was not up to par.  While the staff were pleasant, they seemed to keep forgetting items we asked for such as an extra napkin to clean a wine spill that they made while pouring and left on our table to clean up.  Dropped an appetizer with no side plates and had to get up to go find someone for plates... just silly things, bit we felt more like a nuisance than a guest.  A little pricey for decent food and not great service.

First time trying Wolfgang and it was INCREDIBLE! Our server Ian was amazingly sweet and super tentative to us! Everything he recommend was great! The Truffle Chips were my favorite, following the Parmesan Garlic Bread, and then the meatballs for appetizers. We were so full but ordered entrees any way and I got the Chicken Parmigiana and my friend got the Jidori Chicken. Highly recommend both! Ending with the crème brûlée which was also amazing!! Overall the atmosphere was very welcoming, warm, with bare wood decor. Must try this place out and ask for Ian's section!!! I'll be back for sure!

Our first visit to the new Wolfgang was fantastic!  Zoe, our server, was friendly and knowledgable.  When it was time for Zoe to leave the manager came over to make sure we were ok with it.  Nice touch.  

Neither of us were super hungry so we were looking for small and light.  I had the Big Eye Tuna Tartare as my entree and it was delish.  Hubby had the Chinese Chicken Salad which had the biggest cashews I've ever seen on it.  He said it was perfectly dressed.  Not too sweet.  We shared the Baked sweet potato which was super creamy.  

Ya, I know...random combo of food. ..but it hit the spot and was very tasty!

We were celebrating my sister's bday in Wolfgang Puck at Downtown Summerlin but boy....were we severely disappointed! We ordered pasta, steak, seafood even the dessert and they were so bland! The pasta was supposedly al dente but it tasted like wood! The steak was ordered medium well but when we got it, it was bloody I was worried it would start mooing! The only thing redeeming was the service and the ambiance were excellent...the food was abysmal!

For this type of restaurant, I've only had great to excellent food and excellent service. The only complaint I have is that they keep changing the menu and they get rid of their best dishes. Maybe they aren't selling that well, so their cancelation is justified, but people need to get more adventurous and try things out if that's the case. They had a roast beef sandwich that was so tender and perfectly seasoned that I'm extremely surprised it was cancelled. 

I've been here several times and always 5 stars!

This restaurant was cute and not super busy when we came for brunch. I liked how they offered a 20% discount when you check in on yelp. 

My husband loves his bottomless mimosas so we came here for that purpose. The bartender was actually our server and whenever she saw the glass almost empty she  was always there to fill out up. I had the berry smoothie which was good but the after taste was sour. 

We ordered the avocado toast to start. When it came out it was over piece of toast with avocado, tomato, radish and a handful of salad. We had different expectations because everywhere else we get avocado toast it comes in either two or three smaller breads. 

For our entree we shared a barbeque chicken pizza. The pizza was okay. Not the best I've had but I managed to eat a couple of slices since I didn't really eat much of the avocado toast. 

Overall, if you're coming here for bottomless mimosas I recommend sitting in the bar area. The bartender was very attentive and super friendly. The food was okay, but if you do dine in don't forget to check in!
